William's large hand covered Victoria's breasts, kneading them. His lips moved downward, kissing her lower abdomen.
Victoria shamefully covered her cheeks, not daring to look at him.
William's kisses trailed down from her navel. Victoria nervously grabbed his arm tightly and, gritting her teeth, said, "William, please, don't do this."
William let out a muffled groan, his voice rough and sexy.
His lips continued to rub against her abdomen, leaving one mark after another.
Victoria felt her body heating up, her legs clamping tightly together, her hands involuntarily clenched into fists.
William held down Victoria's restless wrist with one hand, and with the other hand, he reached under her skirt.
Victoria's body tensed up suddenly, her eyes filled with tears.
She shouted, "William, no!"
But Victoria's protest didn't earn William's sympathy; instead, it completely angered him. William tore off Victoria's panties with one hand.
He then lifted her long leg and thrust in forcefully.
Victoria's pupils dilated sharply.
The sudden stimulation made Victoria let out a light cry.
Victoria bit her lip hard, letting the tears slide down her pale cheeks. Her body slowly reacted to William's rhythm.
Seeing Victoria like this excited William even more.
Victoria closed her eyes, trying hard to suppress the waves of sensation coming from her body.
"Victoria, scream!" William roared, thrusting into Victoria forcefully, each thrust harder than the last, reaching the bottom of her vagina. Victoria couldn't bear it any longer and moaned, "No..."
William's eyes grew darker, sweat beads forming on his forehead. The pleasure was almost driving him mad.

The two intertwined bodies pressed against each other. Victoria's body trembled slightly, and she couldn't help but let out a moan, both charming and seductive.
She tilted her head back, sticking out her small tongue to lick her pink lips, her seductive appearance stunning William, who couldn't hold back any longer, thrusting into her fiercely.

He grabbed a towel and gently wiped her down before helping her into her pajamas, then carried her to the bed.
Afterward, he cleaned up and held the soft, fragrant Victoria as they slept.
Victoria slept soundly. With a warm body next to her, she felt especially peaceful.
When she woke up, the golden morning light seeped through the curtains, filling the room.
Victoria felt like she had forgotten something. She got up and went to the bathroom to wash up.
When she opened the bedroom door, she smelled the aroma of food. She followed the scent to the kitchen and saw William frying eggs.
William was wearing casual clothes and an apron. His tall figure and broad shoulders exuded a strong masculine vibe.
Victoria couldn't help but be stunned for a moment, looking at William's back. The events of last night flooded her mind-how she initially refused, and later shamelessly asked for more.
The most crucial thing was that she remembered William saying he had acquired shares of Starry Studio Gallery, becoming the second-largest shareholder.
In other words, he would still be Victoria's boss in the future!
Her expression shifted quickly, and the joy of becoming a full-time employee disappeared like a splash of cold water.
She lowered her eyelashes, hiding the complex emotions in her eyes, and walked out.
William saw Victoria standing at the door, his face cold. He said, "Breakfast is ready. Wash your hands and get ready to eat."
Victoria looked at the fried eggs and toast on the table. Simple as it was, she was a bit surprised; she had always thought that someone like William, a wealthy heir, probably didn't even know how to light a stove.
Victoria walked to the dining table, sat down, picked up the utensils, and ate silently.
William didn't mind her silence, and the two ate their breakfast without a word.
After breakfast, Victoria finally looked up at William, her expression indifferent. "Mr. Scott, I won't beat around the bush. Even though you are now a shareholder of Starry Studio Gallery, I am now a full-time sales representative at the gallery. I won't be your secretary anymore, and I don't want to be your sex object, so please let me go!" As soon as she finished speaking, she met William's half-smiling expression. She suddenly felt uneasy, a vague sense of apprehension creeping in.
William picked up a napkin to wipe his mouth, then said with a half-smile, "Don't worry. In two months, I'll be marrying Ella. By then, even if you want to be my sex object, you won't have the chance."
Victoria was momentarily stunned. Although she had long known that William and Ella were engaged, she always felt that their personalities were so different that they would never actually make it to marriage.
But now, William was telling Victoria that he was getting married.
Victoria thought, 'Does this mean that in two months, I would be free?'
After the initial shock, she couldn't resist the overwhelming joy.
Seeing the change in her expression, especially the uncontrollable joy at the end, William felt a surge of anger rising from within. He wanted to strangle Victoria.

chapters.title: Chapter 36
chapters.content:
William held back his anger and spoke softly, "Just behave for the next two months. Once I'm married, I'll give you what you want. Deal?"
Victoria thought it over, then gritted her teeth and agreed.
William tossed a check at her and said, "Here's your pay for this month. You've done well."
He patted her face and walked away.
Victoria picked up the check, clutching it tightly. A whirlwind of emotions hit her.
After a while, she finally put the check away.
Meanwhile, Ella locked herself in her house and turned on all the lights.
Her face was as pale as a ghost, her eyes empty and filled with fear, her body trembling like a leaf.
The horrifying memory of being locked in the basement kept replaying in her mind. Every detail made her shiver.
Willow opened the door and saw Ella, who still looked terrified, even after being back for a few days. Her heart ached, and she called out, "Ella!"
She rushed over and held Ella's cold hand, trying to comfort her. "Goodness, you look absolutely terrified! William is such a jerk! You're his fiancée; how could he do this to you?"
Seeing Willow, Ella clung to her like a lifeline. She cried out, "Mom! I'm scared! There were so many bugs and rats! It was always dark! I'm so scared!"
Hearing this, Willow hugged Ella tightly, her teeth grinding in anger.
Ella, whom Willow had pampered for over twenty years, had suffered so much.
The one behind all this was that wretched woman, Victoria!
If it weren't for that scheming Victoria seducing William, he wouldn't have made Ella suffer like this!
Willow would never let anyone bully her Ella!
This time, she wouldn't let Victoria get away with it!
But since William was so protective of Victoria, going after her directly wouldn't work.
Willow had to come up with a plan and use someone else to do the dirty work. She would make sure Victoria fell from grace and never recovered!
Today, there was a small exhibition, and Victoria was chatting and laughing with Wendy while arranging the displayed works.
Suddenly, the door burst open, and a swarm of media personnel with cameras and microphones rushed in, bombarding Victoria with sharp questions.
"Victoria, it's rumored that you stayed at Starry Studio Gallery by selling your body to the gallery's shareholders. Is that true?"
"With just a high school diploma, how did you get into a gallery that only accepts top university graduates? Is there some shady deal involved?"
"Victoria, everyone is curious, in such a tough job market, what underhanded methods you used to secure a position at Starry Studio Gallery with such low qualifications. Is your body your biggest asset?"
Hearing this, Victoria was stunned, her face turning pale.
She opened her mouth but didn't know where to start.
Wendy was also shocked by the sudden scene but instinctively stood in front of Victoria, angrily saying, "Don't talk nonsense! Victoria is not that kind of person!"
But the media reporters ignored her and continued to press Victoria.
Victoria tried to calm herself, her voice trembling. "These are all rumors. I stayed at the gallery through my own efforts. I didn't take any shortcuts."
But her explanation seemed weak amidst the chaos.
The media reporters didn't believe her words.
Flashes kept going off, lighting up Victoria's pale face.
Seeing the chaos, Diana knew talking wouldn't help, so she called security to kick the reporters out.
Once the room finally quieted down, Wendy let out a sigh of relief.
She looked at Victoria with concern and tried to comfort her, "Those reporters are full of it. Don't let it get to you."
Victoria was still in shock from the sudden incident. Hearing Wendy's words, she forced a smile.
Diana was also annoyed seeing the reporters still hanging around outside the gallery. She knew it wasn't Victoria's fault, but for now, she could only let Victoria stay home for a few days, for both her sake and the gallery's.
Diana sighed and said to Victoria, "Take a few days off. Don't come to the gallery for now, just rest at home."
When Victoria heard this, her face turned even paler, and she stammered, "Ms. Simpson, are you firing me?"
Seeing that Victoria misunderstood, Diana quickly waved her hand and said, "No, I'm just asking you to go home to avoid any trouble. Don't worry, I've already asked the PR department to draft a statement. I know you're innocent and I won't fire you over baseless accusations."
Victoria felt a bit more at ease hearing this.
Seeing Victoria calm down, Diana arranged for someone to drive her home.
However, on the way, Victoria got a call from Elara. Elara said, "Victoria, don't go home yet. There are people swarming outside your house. Find a hotel to hide in for now; don't let them catch you."
Victoria's heart sank. After comforting Elara, Victoria asked her colleague to drop her off at the nearest hotel.
But when Victoria was about to check in, she realized her ID was still at home.
Standing at the hotel entrance, she looked around, not knowing where to go.
She took out her phone and casually scrolled through Instagram, short video apps, and Twitter, only to find them filled with slander and insults against her.
[Victoria, that shameless bitch, will stop at nothing to climb up. She's a disgrace to the art world!]
[How can someone with just a high school diploma get into Starry Studio Gallery? Jobs are so hard to find nowadays. Countless college graduates are unemployed, and even students from prestigious universities are struggling to find work. She must have used underhanded means to steal others' opportunities. What right does she have to stay? Get out of the art world!]
[How dare someone who sells their body still live in this world? She's a parasite on society!]
[Why does a high school graduate get such good resources? She must have used shady methods. Are the shareholders of Starry Studio Gallery blind to let such trash stay there?]
[No wonder, she's Alvin's daughter, just as despicable! Trash genes!]
[Exactly, Alvin and Victoria Carter are two of a kind-garbage!]
One vicious and malicious comment after another stabbed at Victoria's heart like knives.
Her body went weak, almost collapsing to the ground.
Victoria's hands trembled uncontrollably, and tears welled up in her eyes. She couldn't understand why people would maliciously slander her when she had done nothing wrong. Was not finishing college destined to make her feel inferior?
Even if she gave her all and worked hard, could she still not change her fate?
Victoria wandered aimlessly through the streets, her mind blank, feeling dizzy, with a constant buzzing in her ears.
It was as if the world had abandoned her.

chapters.title: Chapter 37
chapters.content:
William was at a business event when Harry rushed over, having seen something online about Victoria.
William's brows knitted together, and he let out a cold snort. "Isn't she always so stubborn? Don't worry about her. Let her stew for a bit. She'll come crawling back once she learns her lesson."
"But what if she doesn't?" Harry asked, unsure.
A sharp look crossed William's face. "She can't stay away from the gallery job. Just wait and see," he said confidently.
Harry felt uneasy but knew better than to argue. Once William made up his mind, there was no changing it.
"I am off now. I'll ensure to keep you informed of any new updates," Harry said.
William waved him off dismissively.
As he glanced at the wine bottle on the table, William remembered Victoria's reaction when she found out about his engagement that morning.
He narrowed his eyes, picked up the wine glass with his long, clean fingers, and took a sip.
He was curious to see how long Victoria could keep up her stubborn act.
Meanwhile, Victoria was wandering the streets, lost and aimless.
Feeling a cool sensation on her face, she wiped away the tears and realized it had started to drizzle.
Her clothes were getting soaked, and the cold rainwater trickled down her collar, making her shiver.
She hugged herself, curled up into a small ball, and squatted down.
As she cried, she suddenly started laughing-a mix of sorrow and despair.
"How useless," she murmured to herself.
Victoria tilted her head back, closed her eyes, and let the raindrops mix with her tears.
Just then, an umbrella appeared over her, shielding her from the rain.
Victoria opened her eyes to see Samuel holding the umbrella. She stared at him, unmoving.
Samuel, dressed in a camel coat and black pants, looked down at her with a mix of pity and concern.
He reached out, his warm hand touching her cold forehead, and asked gently, "Why are you out here in the rain?"
Victoria blinked her wet eyes and gave a bitter smile. "Professor Brown, I have nowhere to go right now," she said, her voice choked and hoarse.
Samuel moved the umbrella aside, squatted down, and looked at her.
"It's okay; you can stay at my studio for a few days," he said.
He took off his coat and draped it over her shoulders, then gently led her to the blue Bentley parked nearby.
Samuel had quickly contacted Starry Studio Gallery when he saw the news about Victoria and found out where she had last been seen. It didn't take long to find her.
Victoria's cold hand was wrapped in Samuel's warm one, and she felt a twinge of emotion.
Samuel helped her into the car, fastened her seatbelt, then got in the driver's seat and headed to the studio.
Using his fingerprint, he opened the studio door, and Victoria followed him in silence.
Only then did she realize this was Joshua's studio!
In the middle of the studio was a large canvas, the unfinished portrait of a woman that Victoria had seen before, now covered with a cloth.
Why could Samuel unlock this studio?
Victoria's heart was in turmoil as she stared in shock at Samuel's back, struggling to believe it.
Samuel seemed to sense her surprise, turned around, and smiled at her. "Come on, we'll talk later. Change your clothes first," he said.
He handed Victoria a set of studio staff uniforms and continued, "These are brand new, so feel free to wear them. I'll make you a cup of hot tea to warm you up."
Victoria took the clothes in a daze and responded, "Thank you."
She looked at the gentle and handsome Samuel in front of her, her emotions surging.
Victoria went to the bathroom to change her clothes, washed her wet clothes, and hung them up to dry.
She then slowly walked into the living room, where Samuel had already prepared the cold medicine and placed it on the table.
He urged Victoria to drink it quickly, "Take care of your health first. Don't worry about this matter; I'll help you."
Victoria lowered her eyes to the cup of hot tea, her eyes red and brimming with unshed tears.
"Professor Brown, thank you," she murmured, "but I'll handle this myself. I don't want to trouble you."
Samuel pondered for a moment and said, "If you want to handle it yourself, I won't interfere. But if you need my help, just let me know."
"Okay," Victoria responded. She then drank the steaming tea, feeling the warmth spread through her body and her mind clearing.
She looked around the studio and at Samuel, hesitantly asking, "Professor Brown, why do you have..."
Samuel raised an eyebrow and smiled. He asked, "Why can I open this studio door, right?"
Victoria nodded.
Samuel's smile deepened. He continued, "I'm sorry. I lied to you before. You probably guessed it; I'm actually Joshua."
Her suspicion was confirmed, but she was still taken aback. She hadn't expected Samuel to be the artist Joshua, whom she had long admired.
And to help her stay at Starry Studio Gallery, Samuel had willingly sold his paintings to the gallery.
Victoria bit her lip and said seriously, "Professor Brown, thank you. You've helped me so much. But since you're Joshua, why did you want me to come to the studio once a week?"
Samuel smiled slightly, his expression calm. "I wanted to give you more time, but since someone gave me this opportunity, I had to seize it."
He stood up, walked to the covered painting, and pulled off the cloth, revealing a familiar face to Victoria-it was her own portrait.
Seeing this, Victoria was momentarily stunned.
Samuel took out a brush, dipped it in paint, and carefully outlined the eyes.
He was focused and serious, and each stroke seemingly conveyed his feelings, filled with love and tenderness.
His profile was flawless, his clean face like a precious gem.
After he added the final flourish, the painting was truly complete.
The portrait of Victoria had a slight smile, her eyes full of bright joy, exuding a lively vitality, like a delicate and beautiful flower blooming in spring.
Victoria stared at the painting, her heart racing.
Samuel turned around, his gaze gentle, a smile in his eyes. He asked, "Victoria, do you feel my love for you?"

chapters.title: Chapter 38
chapters.content:
Samuel poured his heart into a painting, using it as his ultimate love letter to Victoria.
Victoria was floored by the romantic and stunning artwork, her heart skipping a beat.
Being a painter herself, she could see the care and emotion in every line Samuel had drawn.
She had never seen anything so beautiful. It was like seeing a happier, livelier, but more mature version of herself.
Samuel was wishing her happiness and hope in her future through his art.
How could she not feel the depth of his love?
But she was confused, unsure of what she had done to deserve this, and more importantly, she felt unworthy of such love.
Victoria lowered her head, fighting back tears, and softly shook her head, her voice a bit raspy.
"Professor Brown, I don't get it. Why do you like me?" She looked up at Samuel and continued, "You know my past. How could I ever be a match for you?"
Samuel laughed, his bright eyes locking onto hers. "I don't care about your past; as long as you're willing, I'll always be by your side." He reached out to stroke her hair, his voice low and magnetic, like a fine wine, intoxicating.
Victoria's heart raced, too nervous to speak, avoiding his gaze in a fluster.
She bit her lip, her voice hoarse. "I can't. I'm not worthy of you. We should just..."
"You don't have to rush to reject me; I know this is sudden for you. Don't worry, we artists are very patient." Samuel gently reassured her, "Take your time to think it over, and when you're ready, give me an answer, okay?"
His eyes were so beautiful, so gentle, it was hard to refuse.
Victoria bit her lip, trying hard to suppress the fluttering in her heart.
After a while, she finally mustered the courage to nod. She replied, "I'll think about it carefully; please give me some time."
"Okay, I'll give you time." Samuel smiled with relief and said, "You can stay in the guest room upstairs for the next few days. I've just changed the sheets and bedding for you, so just rest here."
Victoria nodded gratefully, then asked, "What about you?"
Samuel chuckled and replied, "Don't worry. No one will come to the studio these days, and I won't be staying here either. You've had a long day. Get some rest, and don't overthink." With that, he waved at Victoria, "Get some sleep!"
Victoria responded and saw him out of the studio.
After washing up, Victoria lay in bed, thinking about everything that had happened today.
First, she was inexplicably cyberbullied, then Samuel found her, she learned he was Joshua, and then he confessed his love to her.
Her idol, the person she had admired and adored for so long, actually liked her?
The anger from the cyberbullying was gradually replaced by a faint sense of joy.
Victoria patted her flushed cheeks, muttering softly, "Don't overthink. Victoria, calm down!"
Victoria tossed and turned, unable to sleep, as images of Samuel replayed over and over in her mind. Finally, she put on a coat and went downstairs.
Looking at the portrait of herself, Victoria imagined Samuel meticulously painting each stroke, wondering if she could really be with Samuel.
If Samuel didn't mind the difference in their status, she could try to make up for it.
But right now, she was still entangled with William, how could she talk about love?
The thought hit Victoria like a cold splash of water. And thinking of William made her heart ache intensely.
Victoria closed her eyes, trying to suppress the sadness in her chest.
Maybe, after two months, when she had completely ended things with William, she could consider it.
But for now, the most important thing was to clear her name from the slander and online harassment.
Victoria took a deep breath and saw the official statement from Starry Studio Gallery: [Recently, false rumors about our employee Victoria have been widely spread online. Hereby, Starry Studio Gallery formally declares that we have always adhered to professional expertise and overall quality as our hiring criteria, and asserts that there has been no illicit hiring conduct. Victoria was hired based on her own efforts and talent, and she has performed excellently in her work, making positive contributions to Starry Studio Gallery. As for the rumors, we have the right to hold rumor spreaders accountable through legal channels.]
But instead of calming things down, the statement just fueled the fire:
[Victoria must be really capable, the higher-ups are rushing to protect her as soon as this scandal breaks. Who knows how many shady deals are going on behind the scenes.]
[Efforts and talent got her hired? Are you kidding? What kind of talent can a high school graduate have if not for those shady means to climb up? It's disgusting.]
[Having a strong background is different. Someone is always there to clean up the mess. Victoria, keep being smug; one day, your true colors will be exposed.]
[Victoria must have pleased the higher-ups well, that's why they're protecting her!]
[This statement is a joke. If Victoria is really capable, why doesn't she dare to respond to the netizens' doubts directly? Isn't it because she's guilty?]
Reading these nasty comments, Victoria felt a heavy pain in her chest, like a huge stone was blocking her, making it hard to breathe.
The worst part was that they were not only insulting her but also slandering the higher-ups of Starry Studio Gallery.
Victoria clenched her fists. She would never let anyone defame the reputation of Starry Studio Gallery!
Even though Samuel was willing to help her, she still wanted to solve it herself.
She didn't want to owe him too much.
Suddenly, Victoria thought of someone who might be the only one able to help her now. Even though they weren't close and had some past conflicts, she still nervously made the call.
After what felt like forever, Victoria finally put down the phone, a faint smile appearing on her face.
She calmly and composedly began recording a clarification video. In the video, she said, "I am Victoria. First of all, I am very sorry that I have implicated the gallery where I work and consumed too much public attention for my personal issues. At the same time, I want to thank those friends and leaders who have unwaveringly trusted and supported me. Without you, I might not have had the courage to stand here and fight for myself."
At this point, Victoria stood up and bowed, then continued, "I indeed do not have the halo of a high degree, but I have a persistent pursuit and sincere love for art. Like people who work hard for a living, I get up at six in the morning, take a bus, and then transfer to the subway for two hours to get to work. And I don't get home until eight or nine at night to have dinner. I've poured my heart and soul into every project, working tirelessly and investing immense effort. I can proudly say that every step I've taken at Starry Studio Gallery has been earned through my own hard work. If you don't believe me, just check the recently released project list from our gallery; many of the projects have my name on the staff list."
Victoria paused for a moment, then continued, "But even so, some people still think that someone without a college degree like me has no right to outshine the top students from prestigious universities. In other industries, this might not be possible, but in the art industry, a degree is not the only standard to measure a person's ability. Moreover, I was once admitted to Imagination Realm University, but due to family changes, I couldn't continue my studies. However, my teacher, Professor Johnson, still keeps in touch with me and gives me a lot of guidance. If you don't know the status of Professor Johnson, you can look it up."
At the end of the video, Victoria took a deep breath, her tone firm and powerful. "I know that no matter what I say now, it might be questioned, but I still want to ask everyone to give me a chance and the time to prove my innocence. I'm not the despicable person you think I am; I'm just someone who works hard and chases dreams. Please believe in me and don't be misled by rumors."
As soon as the video was released, it caused a huge stir online.

chapters.title: Chapter 39
chapters.content:
Victoria's Instagram followers were blowing up fast.
These days, attention was everything, and Victoria's follower count shot past a million in no time.
But, of course, there were still plenty of haters.
[Who do you think you are? Who knows if you're just making stuff up.]
[Don't think spinning a story will clear your name. You're just a bad person.]
But some folks had her back too.
[Imagination Realm University isn't easy to get into. Getting accepted means she's got talent. Sometimes, in art, raw talent can beat formal training.]
[Maybe we should really think it over and not be so quick to judge.]
While the internet was buzzing about Victoria's video, Irvin-who had previously questioned the fairness of Victoria's success-posted his own video the next day to set the record straight.
Victoria had called him for help, expecting a no. But to her surprise, Irvin agreed right away.
He said he felt bad for misunderstanding her before and now wanted to help.
In his video, Irvin said, "Hey everyone, I'm Irvin. I graduated from the University of Aesthetics Shine and interned with Victoria. When I found out I lost to her, I publicly questioned how a high school student could beat me. I couldn't accept it, thinking that as a top graduate from the University of Aesthetics Shine, how could I lose to someone with just a high school education? But later, I reviewed all the scores given by our trainers. I had to admit that while Victoria's professional skills might not surpass mine, she is diligent, earnest, and attentive to customers. In practical terms, she is indeed better than us so-called top graduates. More importantly, she has a unique appreciation and aesthetic for art that hasn't been shaped by academic systems. Losing to her is not a loss. I admit my talent is not as good as hers, and there's no shame in that. I will learn from this and work harder in the future. Please stop attacking Victoria. She earned this job through hard work, not shortcuts."
After his video, more people started believing in Victoria, especially young folks who had made it on their own.
Ella was fuming when she saw the public opinion shifting towards Victoria.
Ella had gone to great lengths to ruin Victoria's reputation.
But now, Irvin had stepped in and turned things around.
Ella thought, 'What kind of power does she have to make so many people want to help her? And that Lyra, she's so useless, not providing any decisive evidence, no wonder she lost to Victoria.'
If Ella weren't afraid that William might discover her actions, she wouldn't have had to rely on Lyra.
Ella absolutely couldn't let Victoria clear her name.
Thinking of this, Ella remembered someone and a cold smile appeared on her lips.
She thought to herself, 'Victoria, this time I will make sure you are utterly disgraced!'
She then took out her phone and made a call.
Meanwhile, Wendy called Victoria, happily informing her that more and more people were believing in her.
And the media and onlookers around Starry Studio Gallery had significantly decreased. In a few days, Victoria might be able to work normally again.
Hearing the news, Victoria was over the moon. After hanging up, she felt a huge weight lift off her shoulders.
She'd been stressing about getting kicked out of Starry Studio Gallery. But she never saw it coming when Bobby posted an apology video on her behalf, apologizing to the interns who got cut.
While the video was presented as an apology, it was, in fact, a veiled confession that her position had been secured through backroom dealings.
After watching the video, Victoria was shaking with anger.
Bobby had totally stabbed her in the back, making her look even worse!
Nora tricked her into going to the factory for money, and Bobby slandered her for cash, leading to her being cyberbullied.
Such was her family!
Victoria's face went pale as she watched the internet explode with insults again.
[Even your own brother is testifying against you. What else do you have to say? You're a morally corrupt woman, using despicable means to get ahead, pretending to be innocent. Your acting is really convincing!]
[Do you think making a video can clear your name? You're a hypocrite, deceiving everyone from the start. People like you should be condemned by society and never escape your crimes.]
[Artistic pursuits and hard work? It's all a sham! You're just a manipulative woman using your looks to get ahead, treating us all like fools.]
[And that Irvin, he must be bewitched by Victoria's beauty to speak for her. So what if he graduated from the University of Aesthetics Shine? He was still seduced by this promiscuous woman.]
[Irvin isn't a good person either. Maybe he has an improper relationship with Victoria. Chasing after beauty and lacking principles-someone like that doesn't deserve to be an artist.]
Some radical people even went to Starry Studio Gallery to protest, demanding Victoria be fired.
Even the house Victoria rented got vandalized with red paint, with nasty words written all over it.
Irvin's internship place was also getting harassed, making things tough for him too.
Victoria felt like she was being pushed to the edge.
William's eyes were dark as he looked at the growing wave of insults and slander against Victoria online, his brows furrowed.
Seeing this, Harry softly reminded him, "Mr. Scott, should we step in? If this keeps up, Ms. Carter might not be able to handle it."
William pressed his lips together, his expression grim.
He thought, 'This Victoria is really something. Even after all this bullying, she never thought of asking me for help.'
William had underestimated her pride and resilience.
Seeing William unmoved, Harry tried again, "Hugo has already given Diana an ultimatum. If Victoria can't clear her name, no matter how much Diana speaks for her, she must be fired. Although we are the second-largest shareholder, we don't have actual management rights and can't change Hugo's decision. Do you still want to wait?"
William lowered his gaze, his long fingers tapping the table rhythmically.
After a moment, he looked up at Harry, his tone cold. "Well. I can't let her be bullied forever. Go find someone to handle this immediately and make sure to suppress the trending topics."
Harry breathed a sigh of relief upon hearing this, took out his phone, and was about to contact the PR department. His finger swiped across the phone, and he suddenly paused.
He hesitated, looking at William, wanting to say something but stopping.

chapters.title: Chapter 40
chapters.content:
Seeing Harry's face, William frowned and said, "Just say it."
Harry hesitated, then said, "Mr. Scott, we might not need to step in now."
William looked confused. "What do you mean?"
Harry explained, "The trending topics have shifted."
William was taken aback. "Shifted to what?"
Harry handed over his phone and said, "Mr. Thomas is claiming Victoria as his student; turns out Victoria is actually Joshua's student; Shocking: Mr. Thomas's student accused of taking shortcuts; stuff like that."
William grabbed the phone, opened Instagram, and saw that all the nasty posts had been buried.
Joshua, a big shot in the art world, both at home and abroad, never showed up in public.
But now, he had personally set up and verified an Instagram account, which was officially confirmed, just for Victoria's sake.
His first and only post read: [Victoria is my student. Does she need to rely on shady methods to get a gallery job? What a joke!]
With Joshua's backing, the internet went wild.
People were initially shocked by this twist.
It sparked a frenzy in the comments, with many users eagerly sharing the post.
[Oh my God, Joshua's student! That's awesome!]
[Joshua himself got on Instagram to claim her as his student. Unbelievable!]
Some who had previously trashed Victoria now felt pretty embarrassed.
At the same time, some doubted Joshua's words, thinking it might be a publicity stunt.
But soon, others clapped back: [Who is Joshua? He doesn't need cheap tricks for publicity.]
As the debate raged on, more and more people started siding with Victoria. William watched as Joshua completely flipped the script, his lips pressed into a thin line, his face serious.
If Victoria had come to William, he could've fixed everything for her!
But he didn't expect Joshua to swoop in out of nowhere!
He reached for his coffee, but spilled it everywhere, angrily knocking it to the floor.
Harry quickly stepped in to clean up, sneaking a glance at William, who was sitting there radiating cold fury, and muttered, "Mr. Scott, why'd you let such a good chance slip by? If you'd spoken up for Ms. Carter earlier, she'd be grateful and give you her all. Now, someone else beat you to it."
William shot him a cold look and snapped, "Shut up!"
Harry quickly covered his mouth.
William squinted, a dark, complicated look in his eyes, and then said, "Find out who this Joshua really is, why Victoria's suddenly connected to him, and why he's backing her up."
Harry nodded, "Got it, I'll look into it right away."
After Harry left, the big, empty office was just William.
Feeling completely out of the loop, William thought about the close bond between Victoria and Joshua, and a wave of irritation washed over him.
Victoria stared at the Instagram post Samuel had made for her, completely stunned and unable to react for a while.
He actually stood up for her as Joshua!
Wasn't he worried about getting into trouble?
Her heart was a whirlwind of emotions: gratitude, being touched, and a bit of sadness.
The pressure from all the public scrutiny these past days had left her anxious and sleepless. Now, seeing Joshua's statement on Instagram, she finally felt a wave of relief, her heart calming down-only to be replaced by deep worry, afraid of letting him down.
When Samuel walked in with several food boxes, he saw Victoria in a daze.
She looked bewildered, still lost in thought.
Samuel approached, cleared his throat, and said, "Time to eat."
Hearing his familiar voice, Victoria snapped back to reality, realizing Samuel had already come in and the table was filled with delicious dishes.
"When did you come in?" Victoria felt a bit embarrassed. She had been so engrossed in the screen that she hadn't noticed Samuel's entrance.
Samuel smiled and replied, "I've been here for a while. What were you thinking about so deeply?"
"Thank you," she hesitated for a moment and said. "Will saying I'm your student on Instagram affect you?"
Samuel handed her the utensils, smiling slightly. He responded, "Don't you call me Professor Brown every day? It's no problem to say you're my student."
Victoria looked at the food in her bowl, momentarily at a loss for words.
Seeing her still absent-minded, Samuel sighed and said, "If you're really worried, just work hard and achieve something to shut them up!"
When Victoria heard this, her eyes sparkled. Yes, if she were truly excellent, why should she fear those malicious words?
Thinking of this, Victoria solemnly nodded to Samuel and said, "I will work hard."
"That's more like it," Samuel said with satisfaction, "The art association is holding a competition soon. Want to give it a try? I can recommend you."
"Yes!" Victoria immediately nodded excitedly, then hesitated, frowning. "What if I don't win? Wouldn't that embarrass you?" she asked.
"Then I'll expel you from my student list!" Samuel teased her.
Hearing this, Victoria immediately looked distressed. She said, "Don't scare me."
Samuel placed a piece of chicken wing in Victoria's bowl, casually saying, "I've seen your paintings. While there's room for improvement in your technique, your creativity and originality really shine through. With a little guidance from me, winning a place won't be a problem."
Hearing this, Victoria looked up at Samuel happily, just in time to meet his gentle and doting eyes.
His eyes were deep, seemingly capturing her soul, making it hard for her to look away.
Victoria's heart trembled slightly, and she hurriedly lowered her head to avoid Samuel's gaze.
Samuel looked at Victoria's slightly flushed cheeks, feeling a bit moved, and couldn't help but reach out to ruffle her hair.

chapters.title: Chapter 41
chapters.content:
Victoria's whole body went rigid, and her face turned bright red.
She quickly looked down, pretending to be super interested in her food, not daring to glance at Samuel again.
"Hey, slow down. I'm not gonna steal your food," Samuel said, chuckling as he watched her scarf down her meal.
It was only then that Victoria realized she was already pretty full; she had unknowingly eaten more than half a bowl.
It had been ages since she had eaten this much.
It seemed like she could only relax this much when she was with Samuel.
After the meal, they cleaned up the table together.
Samuel pulled out some documents and handed them to Victoria. "Check this out. It's the process and details of the competition. You should start prepping."
Victoria flipped through the papers and nodded. "Okay, don't worry. I'll get ready."
"Alright, I'm heading out now," Samuel said, grabbing his bag and heading for the door.
Suddenly, Victoria grabbed his arm. "Professor Brown, I'm moving back tomorrow. Thanks for everything during this time."
Samuel stopped and turned to look at her, smiling. "Didn't you enjoy staying here?" he asked.
Victoria shook her head. "It's not that I didn't enjoy it. It's just that this is your studio, and it's not right for me to stay here all the time."
Samuel looked at her and nodded. "I respect your decision. Remember, no matter what happens, I'll always be here to help you."
Hearing this, Victoria was momentarily stunned, then lowered her eyes to hide her emotions. "Thank you."
After Samuel left, Victoria sat on the sofa, hugging her knees and staring into space.
No matter what, she had to do her best and not let Samuel's trust and help go to waste.
Early the next morning, Victoria returned to work at Starry Studio Gallery.
Her colleagues excitedly gathered around her, pushing her into a chair and bombarding her with questions.
"Victoria, you're finally back! Tell us, how did you become Joshua's student?"
"Yeah, we're all dying to know. Joshua is a legend in the art world, and you're his student. That's amazing!"
"You really kept this a secret! No wonder you could get two of his works at once before. So you had this connection!"
Victoria felt a bit embarrassed by their enthusiasm. "It was just a coincidence, and I'm only a nominal student. It's not a big deal."
Her colleagues saw that she wasn't eager to talk and expressed their understanding.
"Anyway, it's great now. With Joshua supporting you, those rumors will definitely be dispelled."
"Yeah, we've all seen your hard work and talent. Those people were just talking nonsense."
Everyone was chatting away, making the Starry Studio Gallery lively.
However, Victoria noticed that Wendy was quietly staying in a corner, not saying a word.
Her heart skipped a beat, and she walked over to Wendy, trying to be friendly. "Wendy, I'm back."
Wendy glanced at her and forced a smile. "I see that," Wendy responded.
Wendy didn't know why she felt this way. She had been worried about Victoria, but when she found out that Victoria was Joshua's student, she felt a bit down. She had wanted to celebrate Victoria's return, but seeing so many people around her, she felt uncomfortable and decided to stay in the corner and watch.
Yet Victoria wasn't upset by Wendy's coldness.
She went to the break room, made a cup of coffee, and brought it to Wendy.
Smiling, Victoria said, "Wendy, are you mad at me for not telling you about Mr. Thomas?"
Wendy didn't say anything, still looking down.
Victoria bit her lip and said softly, "Wendy, if I told you that I didn't know the person I knew was Mr. Thomas until yesterday, would you believe me?"
"Really?" Wendy slowly looked up, her eyes filled with doubt.
She finally understood why she was upset. She had talked to Victoria about Joshua many times, and they both admired him. But Victoria had never mentioned that she was Joshua's student, making Wendy feel deceived. More importantly, Wendy felt that Victoria didn't consider her a true friend.
Victoria nodded earnestly and said, "I swear! When I met him, he used a different name. I can't tell you who he is yet, but I swear I didn't know his identity beforehand."
Wendy stared at Victoria, as if trying to determine if she was telling the truth.
Victoria met her gaze steadily.
After a long moment, Wendy snorted, picked up her cup, and took a sip. "I'll believe you this time. But if you lie to me again, our friendship is over!"
Hearing this, Victoria found Wendy's serious little round face incredibly cute.
She couldn't help but step forward, cupping Wendy's face in her hands and giving it a good squeeze. She said, "Wendy, you're so cute like this!"
"What are you doing!" Wendy screamed, covering her face.
Victoria stepped back, smiling, and enjoying Wendy's bashful annoyance that came from her light-hearted teasing.
She glanced at the clock on the wall and said, "It's almost time to open. Let's get to work."
Wendy glared at Victoria and started her own work.
Because of the big news about Victoria, many people in and out of the art circle knew she was Joshua's student.
They came to Starry Studio Gallery out of curiosity to see what Victoria looked like.
Some pretended to be customers wanting to buy her paintings and subtly asked her about Joshua's true identity, but Victoria handled them all skillfully.
She didn't mind the attention. Whether they were genuinely interested in buying art or just there to gawk, she earnestly introduced the various works at Starry Studio Gallery.
Some people were moved by her professionalism and sincerity, and she actually made quite a few sales.
It was almost as much as her sales for the past half month-an unexpected surprise.
As she was about to leave work, her phone rang with a unique ringtone that made her shiver. When she answered, William's voice had a hint of drunkenness. "Come to my place."
Knowing what this invitation meant, Victoria gripped her phone tightly. "I'm really tired today. Can we do this another day?" she asked.
However, William's voice turned cold. "I don't want to repeat myself."
Thinking of their two-month agreement, Victoria gritted her teeth and agreed. "Okay, I'll be there soon."
When Victoria arrived at the Scott Villa, William was lounging on the sofa with his eyes closed.
He was wearing a white shirt paired with black trousers, the sleeves rolled up to his elbows, revealing his strong, slender arms.
His features were incredibly handsome, like a male lead straight out of a comic book.
A cigarette dangled from his mouth, the red glow flickering.
Upon hearing her, he opened his eyes and glanced at Victoria.
"I'm going to take a shower," Victoria said softly.
William extended his hand toward her and said, "No need. Come here."
Tonight, his emotions were a bit turbulent, tinged with a hint of anger.
Victoria hesitated for a moment, then walked over to him.
He pressed her onto the sofa, his deep eyes fixed on her, as if he wanted to devour her whole.
He asked, "How did you manage to hit on Joshua?"

chapters.title: Chapter 42
chapters.content:
Victoria was taken aback for a second and shot back, "Who do you think I'm hitting on?"
William grabbed her delicate neck with one hand, his voice icy, "Besides Joshua, who else could it be?"
Victoria struggled, pushing against his solid chest with both hands.
William's grip tightened, making it harder for her to breathe.
Gasping, she managed to say, "Mr. Thomas is just a teacher I met while auditing at the University of Aesthetics Shine."
As soon as she finished speaking, she felt his fingers loosen around her throat.
Victoria coughed a few times, taking deep breaths to recover.
She really thought she was going to die just now; the feeling of suffocation was unbearable.
William flicked the ash from his cigarette leisurely and said indifferently, "I don't want to hear any nonsense. Tell me the truth. You know I hate being lied to."
Victoria steadied her breathing, slumping on the sofa like a dead fish.
After a while, she sat up.
Her pale face had a strange flush, her hair disheveled, looking somewhat pitiful.
Lowering her eyes, Victoria said hoarsely, "I'm not lying to you. Mr. Thomas is really just a mentor I met while auditing. He took me in as a student out of pity because I was being cyberbullied, but he hasn't actually taught me anything."
Victoria wasn't lying; even if William investigated, he would only find this.
William raised an eyebrow and asked, "That's all?"
"Yes, that's all," Victoria confirmed.
William stared at her for a while, then suddenly sneered.
Victoria was startled, not knowing what his laugh meant.
"Fine, remember what you said. If you dare to flirt with other men behind my back..." William looked at Victoria coldly, a hint of ruthlessness flashing in his eyes before quickly disappearing.
Seeing this, Victoria felt a pang of anxiety.
Thinking of Samuel's confession, she felt a wave of bitterness surge in her heart. Her eyes moistened as she lowered her head without speaking.
"Alright, I've finished my questions. Now for the real business," William said and patted the spot next to him, signaling her to sit over.
Victoria hesitated for a moment but eventually moved over.
As soon as she sat down next to William, he wrapped his arms around her slender, soft waist.
His warm, broad hand rested on her buttocks, kneading through the thin fabric.
Victoria's face immediately turned red, her waist twisting, but she didn't resist for once.
William, satisfied, tightened his grip on her waist, his deep voice sounding in her ear. "That's better. Although watching you resist is quite appetizing, it gets boring after a while."
With that, he stood up and lifted her into his arms.
The sudden feeling of being airborne made Victoria instinctively wrap her arms around his neck.
William carried her to the edge of a bathtub the size of half a room.
He kissed her small earlobe tenderly and said, "The bathtub at your place was too small. I couldn't even exert myself properly last time; I felt really frustrated. This bathtub is big enough. How about we take a bath together?"
William's voice seemed tinged with the steamy mist. His scorching lips fell on her neck and continued downward.
Victoria felt a flush of heat from his shameless words, shyly turning her face away.
Seeing this, William chuckled lowly.
The water was already more than halfway full, emitting a steamy heat, and both of them felt increasingly hot.
William lifted her again and placed her in the water.
Her top was completely soaked, the thin layer of fabric becoming transparent, revealing the outline of her black underwear underneath.
William's gaze grew even more intense.
"Help me undress, got it?" William said flippantly.
Hearing this, Victoria bit her lip, not moving.
"Unwilling? You can choose to leave, but our two-month agreement will be void," William said, starting to unzip his pants.
Victoria quickly grabbed his hand, biting her lower lip. "I'll help you undress," she said.
William leaned back in the bathtub, crossing his legs, enjoying the feel of Victoria's soft hands moving over his body.
After saying that, she climbed off his lap, knelt down, and started unbuttoning his shirt, removing the wet garment.
When it came to his pants, she hesitated.
William urged, "Hurry up. If you take any longer, we'll starve tonight!"
Victoria looked up, meeting his deep, dark eyes, her heart skipping a beat.
She bit her lip and reached for his zipper, slowly pulling down his pants. "Now, is this okay?" she asked.
William, barely able to contain himself, had been suppressing his urges. He replied, "Keep going, there's still one more."
When Victoria heard this, her hand paused for a moment before continuing to remove his underwear.
When their bodies were completely exposed to each other, his erection was already standing at attention for her.
Victoria's face suddenly burned, her head lowering even further.
"It's not your first time. Do I need to teach you what to do next?" William teased deliberately.
Victoria looked up, her eyes misty, looking particularly enticing.
William felt like he was about to explode from holding back, but he still restrained himself, urging, "Hurry up, use your mouth."
Victoria's face turned crimson. Although she had been with him many times, she had never given him a blowjob.
Now being forced, her heart raced, her legs stiffening.
William continued, "Hurry up. I'm waiting for you to please me!"
Victoria licked her dry lips, slowly bending down.
She approached his firm waist, extending her pink tongue to gently lick his erection.
Each touch sent a tingling sensation through him, William squinting his eyes, his Adam's apple bobbing as he let out a low growl.
He felt like all the blood in his body was rushing to one place, ready to burst out.
He groaned, grabbed her shoulders, and began thrusting rapidly into her mouth.
Victoria felt like her throat was being pierced.
She was extremely uncomfortable, unable to help but whimper.
Seeing this, William pulled his erection out of her mouth.
He lifted her onto his lap, gripping her waist, and thrust into her forcefully.
Victoria cried out, her body trembling from the impact.
Her cheeks were flushed, looking beautiful and alluring, her eyes gazing at him with deep affection.
She originally had a pure and delicate appearance, but now, her brows and eyes had taken on a seductive charm.
William's gaze deepened as he leaned forward to press against her. His voice was hoarse as he murmured, "Baby, you're such a tempting enchantress!"
Victoria's face turned even redder at his words, her body going limp.
She stammered, "I'm not..."
However, William rudely covered her lips, prying open her teeth, and entangling her tongue with his.
His lips trailed down, gently nibbling on her nipples, while his lower body continued to thrust into her.
Victoria felt like her body was floating on clouds, as if she was about to leave the earth.
Their breathing grew heavy.
William's breathing became labored, sweat beads forming on his forehead.
Victoria felt like she was about to suffocate, her strength completely drained.
Finally, William was released.
Victoria lay in his arms, panting heavily, her cheeks flushed, looking so beautiful that he couldn't get enough of her.
He then carried her out of the bathroom.
Victoria, completely exhausted, let William carry her to the bed, cover her with a blanket, and then press down on her again, continuing to explore her with vigor.
They tangled on the bed for a while until Victoria was so tired she was about to fall asleep.
William held her in his arms, looking at her with an inexplicable expression. He said, "There's a business dinner tomorrow. You're coming with me."
Victoria, barely hearing him, responded perfunctorily before closing her eyes and drifting off to sleep.

chapters.title: Chapter 43
chapters.content:
The next morning, Victoria woke up still wrapped up in William's arms.
She quietly opened her eyes and saw his chiseled profile.
The warmth from his body made her skin feel unusually hot.
His arm was like a vice, making it impossible for her to wiggle free.
She tried to push him gently, but he didn't budge.
"William," she whispered.
No response.
Victoria frowned and tried to wriggle out of his grip.
Suddenly, William rolled over, pinning her beneath him. "Didn't anyone ever tell you not to squirm in a man's arms first thing in the morning?" he said.
She felt his morning wood pressing against her and froze.
Her eyes widened in disbelief.
They'd gone at it several times last night. Wasn't he tired?
Was this guy for real?
William raised an eyebrow and teased, "What's on your mind?"
"Nothing," she said, quickly looking away.
Seeing she wasn't lying, William let it go. He released her, sat up, and said, "Get up, it's time for breakfast."
He got out of bed, got dressed, and left the room.
Victoria got up, put on the spare clothes she had brought, and freshened up.
She headed to the dining room.
William was already dressed in a white suit, standing by the window, talking on the phone.
A gentle smile, one she'd never seen before, spread across his face. "Yeah, I just got up," he said.
Seeing her, he pointed to the breakfast spread on the table.
Victoria sat down and started eating her oatmeal.
"Okay, take care," William said into the phone.
After hanging up, he looked at Victoria and smiled. "You've been more obedient than I expected lately."
Victoria lowered her eyes and said, "You promised me freedom in two months. I should be smart and not piss you off."
William's good mood vanished. He sneered, "Since you're so sensible, I hope you'll be just as obedient at tonight's business dinner."
Victoria frowned. "What business dinner?"
"Didn't you agree last night? Or are you planning to back out?" William's tone was threatening.
Victoria remembered his demands from last night. Did she agree to something?
"Alright," she sighed. "But at least tell me who I'm dealing with!"
William, satisfied with her compliance, said, "Remember Kirk and Rufus? You promised them you'd follow up on that project, but then you quit. The project's almost done, and they specifically asked for you tonight."
Victoria remembered Rufus's lecherous looks and felt disgusted.
But she didn't want to anger William.
"I'll come after work," she reluctantly agreed.
She grabbed her bag and left for work.
William watched her go, his gaze unreadable.
He thought, 'Victoria, I gave you a chance, but you didn't take it. Don't blame me for teaching you a lesson.'
After a long, grueling day at work, Victoria felt like her legs were about to give out.
She rubbed her sore legs and turned down Wendy's dinner invite.
She freshened up her makeup to look a bit more alive and grabbed a cab to the address William had given her.
When she found the private room, she pushed the door open and stepped inside.
Besides William, the only other people there were Kirk and Rufus, who she'd met before.
Rufus's eyes roamed over her shamelessly, while Kirk was busy chatting with William about the project's profits.
Victoria hated the way Rufus looked at her. She lowered her head and softly said, "Sorry I'm late."
Rufus patted the seat next to him and smiled warmly, "Ms. Carter, come on in. Have a seat and make yourself comfortable."
His eyes stayed glued to her, making her feel grossed out.
She hesitated, but William gave her a look that told her to sit next to Rufus.
Reluctantly, she sat down.
Rufus's eyes lit up. He put his hand on her shoulder and leaned in closer.
"Ms. Carter, since you're late, you owe us three drinks," he said.
Victoria instinctively pulled away, grabbed a glass of wine, and downed it in one go.
The wine spilled down her neck and into her collarbone, hinting at her cleavage.
Rufus's gaze was burning into Victoria.
Victoria's face darkened, and she awkwardly adjusted her neckline to cover up.
Rufus licked his lips, looking unsatisfied.
William watched Rufus's behavior with growing impatience, sipping water to hide his disgust.
If his grandfather hadn't disapproved of him and hadn't pushed him to forge his own path, he wouldn't have to deal with people like Rufus.
But William thought using Rufus to teach Victoria a lesson wouldn't hurt. She'd lied to him about Joshua, and if he didn't put her in her place, she'd get too bold.
A sinister smile crept onto William's face.
Rufus couldn't take his eyes off Victoria.
He moved closer, touched her arm, and said, "One glass isn't enough; we agreed on three."
Victoria felt sick under his gaze. She forced herself to stay calm and said, "Mr. Chapman, you're doing great. Why make things hard for me?"
Rufus squinted, displeased. "What? Ms. Carter, you weren't like this before. Think the project's done, so you don't need to humor us anymore?"
"Mr. Chapman, you're joking. How could I dare?" Victoria forced a smile and apologized.
Rufus, pleased, patted her shoulder.
"Ms. Carter, you're straightforward. Let's keep drinking," he said, handing her another glass.
Victoria reluctantly took it and drank.
She glanced at William, but he was indifferent, laughing and chatting with Kirk.
Her heart sank.
She knew William was making things hard for her because of the Joshua incident.
Victoria smiled bitterly. Even after last night, William had no mercy.
Such a William was truly terrifying.
She put down the glass and said, "Excuse me, Mr. Chapman. I need to use the restroom."
Without waiting for his permission, she headed to the restroom and vomited.
After washing her hands, she was about to leave when someone grabbed her wrist.
She turned and met Rufus's lecherous gaze, making her scream and step back. "Mr. Chapman, you..."

chapters.title: Chapter 44
chapters.content:
Fueled by the booze, Rufus flashed a sleazy grin, his greasy, pudgy face lighting up. "Ms. Carter, don't be so shy. Be my woman, and I'll make sure you're happy," he slurred.
As he spoke, Rufus shut the bathroom door and reached for Victoria's chest.
Victoria screamed, quickly covering herself and struggling desperately.
"Let go!" she shouted.
She fought with all her might, but Rufus's grip was too strong.
Rufus laughed, holding her tightly with both hands.
Unable to break free, Victoria kicked and hit him with everything she had.
But how could a frail woman overpower a fat man?
William and Kirk were deep in conversation when they heard the commotion from the bathroom and immediately stopped talking.
Kirk knew exactly what kind of person Rufus was.
He glanced at William to gauge his reaction.
But William's expression remained unchanged, cold as ice.
Kirk then touched his nose and continued chatting, pretending he hadn't heard anything.
On the surface, William appeared calm, but under the table, his hand was clenched into a fist, veins bulging.
'Damn it! Doesn't Victoria know to ask me for help?' he thought.
Just because she was mad at him, she'd rather be violated by that ugly Rufus?
Victoria wanted to call for help, but her throat, sore from being choked by William the night before and the alcohol just now, burned with pain. Combined with the alcohol she had consumed and her overwhelming fear, she couldn't speak.
She could only let Rufus tear open the buttons on her shirt, pinning her hands above her head against the wall.
Rufus's alcohol-laden mouth kissed Victoria's delicate neck.
Victoria felt extremely nauseous, but her body was limp, unable to muster the strength to struggle.
She looked at the bathroom door in despair, hoping that William would remember their time together and come to her rescue.
She desperately tried to shout, "William, help me!" But no sound came from her throat.
However, the commotion in the bathroom was too loud for those outside not to hear.
The only reason William hadn't reacted must be intentional.
He was deliberately letting someone humiliate Victoria, to get back at her!
In his eyes, she was nothing more than a whore to be humiliated.
When she realized this, her heart was filled with despair.
But the more desperate she felt, the more she couldn't belittle herself.
She had a new job and new friends. William couldn't, and didn't deserve to, ruin her life.
Rufus's repulsive, fat hand had already reached under her skirt, moving upward.
In an instant, Victoria became fierce. Her hands and feet were restrained, but she still had her mouth!
She used all her strength to bite Rufus's ear, tearing off a large chunk.
"Bitch!" Rufus cried out in pain.
Furious and humiliated, he raised his hand and slapped Victoria hard.
Victoria fell to the ground, her cheek quickly swelling and reddening.
Ignoring everything else, she got up and ran out of the bathroom.
"Stupid bitch!" Rufus cursed and chased after her.
Victoria stumbled to the table, not caring about William's extremely displeased expression.
She grabbed a wine bottle and smashed it over Rufus's head as he caught up.
Caught off guard, Rufus took the hit to the forehead, blood splattering everywhere.
He glared at Victoria, seething with hatred. "You bitch, how dare you hit me? I'll kill you!" he snarled, swinging his fist at her.
Victoria, exhausted, couldn't dodge, watching helplessly as Rufus lunged at her.
At the critical moment, William stood up, grabbed Rufus's fist, and kicked him away.
Rufus hit the ground, screaming in pain.
Seeing Rufus in such a state, Kirk quickly checked on him and found that, aside from the missing chunk of his ear, he was mostly unharmed.
He then glared at Victoria and William and said, "What are you doing? This was supposed to be a celebration, and now you're trying to kill him?"
William shielded Victoria behind him, his gaze deep and cold.
"Don't you know what filthy thing he did?" William asked.
Kirk was momentarily stunned, then laughed, "Mr. Scott, you can say whatever you want, but do you have any evidence?"
This seemed to remind Rufus, who struggled to his feet and shouted, "Who the hell do you think you are? Didn't you give her to me yourself? Now you're playing the hero?"
William stiffened, glancing back at Victoria, who still had her head down, her expression unreadable.
Seeing this, Rufus grew even more arrogant and sneered, "William, you got tired of Victoria and tossed her to me. Now you're pretending to be righteous? How disgusting."
William's face darkened, almost dripping with anger, and he roared, "Shut up!"
Rufus laughed maniacally and said, "Who do you think you are? Telling me to shut up? Do you believe I'll terminate our contract right now and make you lose everything?"
Hearing this, William laughed, but his eyes grew colder.
He suddenly walked over to Rufus, squatted down, and patted his flabby face. "Do you think you can offend me so easily? I tailored products for your company, knowing all your strengths, weaknesses, and even your secrets, like your tapioca-free tapioca flour," he said.
Rufus and Kirk's faces turned pale; they didn't expect that William even knew about that.
William stood up, looking down at them. He continued, "I hope you'll double the advertising fee for the Scott Group's hard work, or I might start talking."
With that threat, William pulled Victoria away.
Rufus and Kirk exchanged glances, and after a while, Kirk sighed, "Rufus, we've really lost big this time."
Rufus's face turned ashen as he realized he had been set up by William-using Victoria to create a rift and then seizing the opportunity to extort more investment. Utterly cunning.
He gritted his teeth, eyes filled with malice. "Once I deal with William, I'll skin him alive and sell that slut Victoria as a prostitute!" he spat.
William led Victoria out of the hotel and into his dark blue Maybach, where Harry immediately drove away. Throughout the ride, Victoria kept her head down in silence. William, feeling inexplicably guilty, reached out to wipe the blood from her mouth, but she turned her head away.
The car fell into a suffocating silence.
William couldn't stand the silence. He suddenly asked, "Why didn't you call for my help earlier?"

chapters.title: Chapter 45
chapters.content:
Victoria gave William the cold shoulder, making him frown hard. With a voice dripping with annoyance, he snapped, "Talk to me!"
Victoria glanced up, her eyes welling up with tears. She bit her lip, shaking as she tried to get the words out.
But as soon as she tried to speak, she felt as if she was choking, with her throat burning intensely, and her eyes got even more watery.
William's chest was heaving, his face turning a nasty shade of red.
Trying to keep his anger in check, he softened his tone a bit and said, "Alright, whatever happened is done. Don't worry, I'll make sure you get justice!"
Hearing this, Victoria thought, 'So this is William-so cunning, so heartless! He never saw me as an equal.'
To him, she was just a tool, a pawn he could use, someone he could insult and trample on whenever he wanted.
Yet she still had hopes for this cruel, heartless devil!
How ironic!
Victoria suddenly felt exhausted, a wave of weariness washing over her, and she slowly closed her eyes.
William saw her unresponsive demeanor, and his mood hit rock bottom.
Clearly, Victoria hadn't asked for his help, yet now she looked like she was on the verge of death.
Hadn't he already taught that jerk a lesson for her?
What more did she want?
Did she expect him to apologize?
William felt extreme disgust.
"Since you don't want to talk to me, I won't waste my time. Harry, stop the car!" he barked.
Startled and unsure of what had ticked William off, Harry quickly hit the brakes and pulled over.
William opened the car door, got out, walked to the other side, and yanked Victoria out.
His grip was too strong, causing Victoria to stumble and fall awkwardly onto the road.
William looked down at her, his gaze icy. He said, "Victoria, you better understand your place. You're nothing but a plaything I bought. You have no right to throw a tantrum with me!"
He paused, then added, "If you keep pissing me off, you'll regret it!"
But Victoria gritted her teeth, lifting her defiant eyes to meet his cold, bone-chilling gaze, and finally forced out a single word: "Whatever!"
Even saying just one word made her throat burn painfully.
William's anger flared up when he sensed her stubborn attitude, and he kicked her in the stomach.
Victoria let out a muffled groan, collapsing to the ground.
She propped herself up on her knees, curling her body, her shoulders trembling slightly as if crying, but she tried hard not to make a sound.
Seeing her in such pain, William regretted his impulsiveness.
But apologizing to her? No way.
He thought Victoria needed to suffer to learn her lesson.
So William gave her a cold glance, then turned and got back into the car.
Harry looked at Victoria's miserable state in the rearview mirror, then at William's tense profile, feeling a mix of emotions.
Victoria, such a tough girl, would rather take a beating than beg for mercy.
But William was heartless, completely ignoring her feelings.
Glancing at William in the back seat, Harry couldn't help but say, "Mr. Scott, it's pitch dark. Are we really going to leave Ms. Carter here?"
William waved his hand impatiently and said, "Enough, just drive! Isn't she tough? Why are you worried about her?"
Harry sighed and stepped on the gas.
Victoria lay on the ground, her back aching from the cold, but she stubbornly stayed silent.
The shadows of the trees above fell on her pale cheeks, making her look even more desolate and lonely.
She lay there, staring at the gray, hazy night sky.
She was never one to give up easily, but today, she suddenly felt tired of living.
Nora, always scheming to take from her.
Bobby, backstabbing her for his own gain.
Alvin, the only one who cared for her, suffering in prison, and she could do nothing for him.
And here she was, selling her body, selling her dignity, yet still holding onto a sliver of hope that William, who bought her, would show her some pity.
It turned out to be her Stockholm syndrome manifesting as a masochistic tendency.
She was utterly despicable, both mentally and physically!
She had never hated herself so much for clinging to life.
The sound of a text message suddenly broke the silence of the night.
Victoria was momentarily stunned before reacting.
She struggled to sit up, fumbled for her phone in her bag, and swiped the screen to check.
It was from Samuel: [How's the preparation for the competition going?]
Victoria's fingers trembled slightly as she held the phone, and it took her a while to reply: [I'm preparing.]
[Samuel: Okay! Keep it up! You are the 'Wounded Angel,' and one day you will rise towards the sun!]
Victoria stared at the words on the screen for a long time before slowly locking the screen.
"The Wounded Angel" was a famous painting by the symbolist master Hugo Simberg.
In the painting, two boys carried an injured angel on a stretcher.
The angel's eyes were bandaged, its wings battered, but it held a few snowdrops in its hands.
Despite the image's sense of decay, desolation, and negativity, the snowdrops symbolized healing and rebirth, representing hope for the future even when severely wounded.
It gave people the courage to persevere through hardships.
Victoria understood Samuel's intention.
In this world, besides Alvin, there was Samuel who cared for her.
Victoria felt a warmth in her heart, her nose stinging, and her eyes misting with tears.
She struggled to get up from the ground, her body still swaying slightly.
Leaning against the wall of the alley, she slowly moved forward.
Others might bully her, insult her, or look down on her, but would she just accept it?
No, she wouldn't.
She would live out her abilities and values, making everyone look at her in a new light.
Even if she was humble to the dust, she would never again bow and scrape, allowing others to trample on her.
Victoria wiped the tears from her cheeks and, with heavy steps, took a shortcut to the subway station.
Meanwhile, William sat in the car, his face so cold it seemed to solidify.
The recent scene replayed in his mind, and he felt a twinge of softness.
He rubbed his temples, exhaling irritably.
Victoria was like a poison!
Whenever William encountered her, he lost his rationality.
William sighed deeply and ordered Harry, "Turn back!"

chapters.title: Chapter 46
chapters.content:
Harry was already creeping along, just waiting for William's signal.
The moment he heard it, he cranked the wheel, slammed the gas, and the sports car roared to life.
When they got back to where they had been, Victoria was gone.
William pulled out his phone, stared at Victoria's number, hesitated, then dialed.
Meanwhile, Victoria was at the subway station, waiting for the train. Her clothes were a mess, and she was half-squatting, clutching her stomach in pain.
Then her phone rang.
She pulled it out, saw who was calling, and froze.
A bitter smile crept onto her pale face.
They were done, and now William wanted to call and rub salt in the wound?
Without a second thought, she hit reject.
After that, she blocked his number.
Today, she had played her part in the scheme and made back a hundred times what he had spent on her.
From now on, she wanted nothing to do with him.
William stared at the disconnected call, his brows knitting together, lips pressed tight.
Was Victoria out of her mind to hang up on him?
Harry glanced in the rearview mirror, saw William's stormy expression, and wisely kept his mouth shut.
The air in the car was so thick that it felt like you could hardly breathe.
William gripped his phone, anger bubbling up inside him.
He had swallowed his pride to come back for her and even called her.
How could she be so ungrateful?
Harry sneaked another look at William and cautiously asked, "Mr. Scott, should I take you home now?"
William shot him a frosty glare, and Harry clammed up, not daring to say another word.
William swallowed his anger and called Victoria again.
This time, he got a message saying the call couldn't go through.
His face darkened even more. He looked at Harry, an idea forming. "Give me your phone!"
Harry handed it over, and William quickly dialed Victoria's number.
The call connected, but she hung up again.
When William tried again, it wouldn't connect.
In a fit of rage, William hurled the phone at the windshield, shattering it.
The loud crash echoed in the car, then silence fell.
William clenched his teeth, veins bulging on his forehead.
'Damn Victoria! Blocking my number? Does she really think she's that tough? Let's see how she manages without my protection. What can her weak self do?'
"Drive!" William barked, his anger palpable.
Harry shivered, glancing sadly at his shattered phone.
Did William forget it was his phone?
And it was brand new!
Harry felt like crying but started the car in silence.
Victoria dragged herself home, exhausted.
It was dark, no lights on.
She didn't bother turning them on, heading straight to her easel and switching on the wall lamp.
The dim light cast shadows around the room.
She didn't change out of her dirty clothes or tend to her small cuts and bruises.
She picked up a charcoal pencil and started sketching.
She wanted to capture her sadness and frustration.
But more importantly, she wanted to convey her resolve to live well in her sketch.
Victoria lost track of time as she drew.
Her legs were numb, her wrist stiff, and she could barely hold the pencil anymore.
But when she saw the finished sketch, a faint smile of relief crossed her lips.
The drawing showed a dark forest with twisted trees, their branches tangled together like a giant cage.
The ground was littered with fallen leaves and dead branches, giving off a sense of decay.
In the heart of the forest, a white deer lay curled up, its fur a bit messy. It looked up at the blue sky with eyes full of emptiness and despair, but also a hint of hope and struggle.
Around the deer were broken mirror fragments, reflecting its shattered past. But on its back, a pair of magnificent wings were slowly growing. These wings were colorful and dreamlike, the feathers gently fluttering, ready to break free and soar into the sky.
Victoria put down the charcoal pencil, leaned against the drawing table, and let out a long sigh of relief.
She then stripped off her dirty clothes, tossed them in the trash, took a shower, and changed into clean pajamas.
She applied ointment to her wounds and drank some syrup to soothe her throat.
After all that, she collapsed into bed and fell asleep, exhausted.
The next morning, the warm sun broke through the clouds and shone on the roof.
Sunlight streamed through the curtains, chasing away the cold of the previous night.
Her body and throat still ached a bit, but it was nothing new for Victoria, who was used to getting hurt.
While she was washing up, she heard a knock on the door.
Elara came in with a bowl of oatmeal, concern in her voice. "Victoria, why did you come home so late again last night? I heard noises in the middle of the night."
She looked at Victoria's pale, tired face with worry.
Victoria felt a bit warm inside but held back her tears, managing to say, "Elara, don't worry. I just went out with friends yesterday."
Elara handed her the bowl and said softly, "That's good. I thought you had to work overtime at the gallery."
Victoria took the bowl, scooped up a spoonful of oatmeal, and ate it.
The sweet taste spread in her mouth, making her feel a bit better, even though her throat was still sore.
Victoria looked up and gave Elara a bright smile, hoarsely saying, "Thank you, Elara."
Elara gently patted her head and said, "No need to be formal with me. Eat it while it's hot. I spent a long time making it."
"Okay." Victoria nodded.
Watching Victoria eat breakfast, Elara felt a surge of affection.
She was such a good girl, so obedient and capable.
It was just a pity that Victoria had had some unfortunate family issues.
Elara looked around and noticed that it was almost winter, and Victoria still had thin bedding and sheets.
Victoria must be too busy with work to have time to change to thicker bedding.
Thinking of this, Elara said, "Victoria, it's been getting cold lately. If you don't mind, I can take out your winter clothes and change the bedding for you, okay?"
Hearing this, Victoria was momentarily stunned and quickly shook her head. "No need, Elara. I can take care of it myself over the weekend."
Elara scolded her gently, "You're being too formal with me. I see you as my own daughter. Are you going to distance yourself from me?"

chapters.title: Chapter 47
chapters.content:
Victoria looked down and murmured, "Thanks, Elara."
"Not at all, Victoria. Let's eat," Elara said, giving her shoulder a gentle pat.
Later, Victoria gathered her stuff and headed to work. Before she left, she gave Elara a tight hug.
"Elara, thanks a lot," she said.
Elara was taken aback for a second. She softly stroked Victoria's hair and reassured her, "You're welcome, Victoria; just focus on your job."
After Victoria left, Elara started sorting through Victoria's seasonal clothes.
Since the weather was nice, she decided to wash Victoria's bedding and other laundry.
While she was busy, there was a sudden loud knock on the door.
Elara frowned.
Could it be some kid messing around?
She sighed, opened the door, ready to give the person a piece of her mind.
To her surprise, standing at the door were Ella and Willow, both dressed to the nines.
They had planned to ruin Victoria's reputation through Lyra.
But they didn't expect Joshua to show up and wreck their plan.
So they had lost millions of dollars for nothing.
Ella and Willow weren't about to let this slide.
With the wedding coming up, they were even more frustrated with nowhere to vent their anger.
Seeing all their schemes fail, Ella and Willow feared that if they tried anything more drastic, William would get really mad and call off the wedding. After a long discussion, they decided to confront Victoria directly. Whether by bribery or threats, they were determined to make her leave William, and even if it caused a scene, they were confident it wouldn't affect them.
So Ella and Willow went straight to Victoria's house and rang the doorbell.
Elara didn't recognize Ella and Willow and thought they were Victoria's friends because of their fancy clothes.
So she politely asked, "Are you here to see Victoria?"
In a fit of rage, Willow just ignored Elara. She shoved her aside and yelled, "Where's that bitch Victoria? Get her out here!"
Elara was almost knocked over by the sudden push.
Hearing Willow call Victoria a bitch, she immediately glared.
"Who are you? How dare you insult Victoria!" Elara demanded sternly.
"Who we are is none of your business! I just want to know where that slut Victoria is! Get her out here!" Ella pointed at Victoria's room and screamed.
Elara, usually calm, couldn't take it anymore.
