"It's my fault, I let Ella down, I broke my promise. Ella, if you really hate me, you can take your kidney back! I've made up my mind, even if I die, I won't let William go to you." Alice cried bitterly.
Ella was stunned, her eyes wide with shock, unable to believe that Alice could say something so shameless.
Her chest heaved with anger, and she pointed a trembling finger at Alice, saying, "You... you, you bitch, are you even human? Fine, you want to give it back to me, right?"
As she spoke, Ella grabbed a fruit knife from nearby and lunged at Alice.
Seeing this, William's expression changed, and he kicked Ella away.
With a loud crash, Ella fell to the floor, hitting her forehead on the corner of the coffee table, immediately drawing blood.
A wave of searing pain hit her, and Ella screamed in agony.
"Ella!" Willow screamed, rushing over to support her. "Are you okay, Ella? Does it hurt?"
Ella was in too much pain to speak, and Willow, panicking, pulled out her phone and dialed 911. "I need an ambulance, please help, my daughter is hurt!"
She cried out, her voice hoarse and heart-wrenching.
William glanced coldly at the blood-covered Ella, his brow furrowing, his gaze growing even colder.
Seeing his indifferent attitude, Willow became even more furious and shouted at Alice, "Alice, you damn bastard, if anything happens to her, I won't let you off!"
Alice's eyes filled with tears as she cowered beside William, silently wiping her eyes.
William pulled her into his arms, comforting her softly, "It's okay, I'm here."
Then he turned to Ella and said, "I said I would compensate you on her behalf. If you want ten million dollars, or even a hundred million dollars, just say the word; I can give it to you. But from now on, Alice owes you nothing."
Ella felt that the pain from her head injury was nothing compared to the pain William's words caused her.
She suddenly laughed, looking at William with a sorrowful expression, "William, I risked my life for you, and this is how you treat me? You keep humiliating and hurting me for this mentally unstable Alice..."
"Enough! Ella, stop talking! I don't care what you think." William couldn't hold back and interrupted her.
"Fine, I brought this on myself." Ella laughed bitterly, slowly getting up from the floor and heading upstairs.
Willow thought she was going to change clothes and quickly followed, "Sweetie, I'll go with you to change clothes."
William glanced in their direction and said to Zachary, "Mr. Garcia, Alice just got back, I'll take her to my place to rest for a while."
"Alright, go ahead." Zachary sighed helplessly, watching everything unfold.
William picked up Alice and strode out.
Just as they stepped out of the living room, a dark figure suddenly fell from above, landing in front of them.
Alice screamed in fright.
It was Ella!
She lay on the ground, half of her body stained with blood.
Willow looked down from the third floor, seeing Ella covered in blood, she was so scared that her legs gave out and she collapsed to the floor, unable to speak.
William pressed his lips together, squatted down to check on Ella.
After a moment, he said in a deep voice, "Take her to the hospital."
Alice stared blankly at Ella's horrific state, her eyes gradually turning blood-red.
A few days later, Victoria went back to the hospital for a follow-up as per the doctor's orders.
Afterward, she quietly peeked into Nora's room.
Although she had decided not to care about her anymore, she couldn't help but check on her condition.
The young nurse saw her and couldn't help but sigh, "Nora has such a good daughter, but she wasn't cherished. It's really foolish."
If anyone treated Victoria well, she would give her heart and soul in return.
The nurse stepped forward and led Victoria aside, "Ms. Carter, you don't need to worry too much. Your mother's condition is quite stable, and she has caregivers looking after her. You can rest assured."
"Thank you," Victoria nodded. "Please take good care of my mom."
"It's our duty," the nurse smiled.
Victoria was about to leave when the nurse stopped her and asked, "Ms. Carter, do you know someone named Ella?"
After all, the story of Victoria, William, and Ella was no secret in the hospital.
Victoria was taken aback, then nodded, "I know her."
The nurse continued gossiping, "She jumped off her house, did you know?"
"Jumped... jumped off her house?" Victoria's mind buzzed. Ella actually jumped off a building?
The nurse shook her head, "I don't know the details, but it seems she jumped from the third floor. Luckily, she fell into a flower bed, so her life isn't in danger, but she's seriously injured."
Victoria left the nurse's station in a daze.
She couldn't believe that Ella would have such a strong and impulsive nature, willing to jump off a building and risk her life.
How deep must her love be?
Victoria shook her head. No matter how deep the love, if you fell for the wrong person, it was destined to be a tragedy.
Moreover, doing this only brings pain to those who care and joy to those who hate.
People would be glad to see you gone, out of their way.
As Victoria took the elevator to the first-floor lobby, she saw Willow pushing Ella's wheelchair, waiting for the elevator.
Even though Victoria knew Ella was seriously injured, seeing her in this state still shocked her.
Ella's face was pale, her arms and legs wrapped in bandages, even her head and neck were covered in gauze.
Except for her face, she looked like a mummy.
Victoria stared at her, unable to react for a long time.
Ella also saw Victoria.
Her previously lifeless face suddenly filled with intense hatred. She glared at Victoria and cursed through gritted teeth, "Bitch! Are you here to laugh at me?"

chapters.title: Chapter 65
chapters.content:
Victoria immediately put away her slight pity for her.
Ella deserved this outcome entirely.
"Watching you make a fool of yourself? Ridiculous." Victoria's lips twitched as she mocked, "Do you think everyone's interested in you?"
"You..." Ella had just opened her mouth when a sharp pain surged through her body, causing her to groan in pain.
Willow quickly reached out to hold her, "Ella, what's wrong?"
Victoria couldn't be bothered to argue with her and lifted her foot to leave.
Seeing this, Ella hurriedly called out to her, "Victoria, I have something to say to you!"
Victoria stopped in her tracks, her back to Ella, and mocked, "What? Haven't you insulted me enough?"
Ella signaled Willow to push her wheelchair in front of Victoria.
Because it was a private hospital, there weren't many patients.
"Victoria, if I were you, I would never be a mistress hiding in the shadows. I would do everything I could to win him over and be his legitimate girlfriend!" Ella stared at Victoria with a vicious look.
Hearing this, Victoria squinted slightly, "Ella, you lost the man to someone else and now you want to incite me to get involved in this complicated mess, hoping to kill two birds with one stone? Do you think everyone is as stupid as you?"
"Do you dare say you haven't coveted him?" Ella sneered, "Do you think pretending to be pure and weak can hide your ugly desires?"
Victoria didn't deny it and retorted, "Compared to someone like you who loses their mind for love, I am indeed very smart, much smarter than you! And let me tell you, I have no interest in your William. If he hadn't forced me, I would have stayed far away from you two!"
Hearing this, Ella's face turned extremely ugly, "You're lying! If you weren't good at seducing men, why would William always be infatuated with you? As his fiancée, he has never touched me..."
"Shut up!" Victoria interrupted her coldly, "I have no interest in your relationship, nor do I want to get involved in your love triangle."
With that, she turned to leave.
"Do you think saying that will make her let you go?" Ella suddenly laughed, "Alice Garcia is a lunatic! As long as she knows you've been with William for so long, you won't have a good ending!"
Hearing this, Victoria stopped abruptly and turned to look at Ella.
Alice? Was she the woman William was holding that day?
Could she be Ella's sister?
Ella's expression was twisted and crazed as she spoke word by word, "My dear sister, who seems harmless and gentle, is actually terrifyingly vicious!"
As she spoke, she struggled to lift her clothes, revealing a horrifying scar to Victoria, "Look at this! This is the scar from when I donated a kidney to her! She promised that if I gave her my kidney, she would let me marry William. But as you saw, on my wedding day, she showed up and effortlessly took William away! Now I'm missing a kidney and being ridiculed by countless people because the groom ran away! And all of this was orchestrated by my dear sister!"
By the end, Ella was screaming hysterically.
Victoria listened quietly to Ella's accusations and finally spoke after a long pause, "I told you, I'm not interested in your affairs. Whatever you want to do is your business, don't drag me into it."
With that, she didn't linger any longer and walked towards the door.
Ella seemed to hear an extremely ridiculous joke, "Do you think you can stay out of it? Just wait, your end might be worse than mine."
Victoria ignored her and left directly.
Starry Studio Gallery recently took on a project to design the display for a newly opened home goods department store.
The owner of this building had always been a major client of Starry Studio Gallery, so Diana paid extra attention to this design, ensuring every detail was perfect.
Victoria, Wendy, and the other dozen employees of Starry Studio Gallery, along with the store staff, worked overtime for almost a month to get it mostly done.
Only minor adjustments were needed.
The building's owner also opened for a trial run, only for some VIP members.
Victoria had been on-site these days, recording and adjusting based on customer feedback and attitudes.
While she was working diligently, her phone kept ringing non-stop.
Annoyed, Victoria took it out and saw it was that idle rich kid again.
The rich kid's name was Alton Bridges, the son of the home goods department store's owner, and a college student.
A while ago, when he came to inspect the mall on behalf of his father, Diana assigned Victoria to accompany him and listen to his feedback.
After getting to know each other, Alton, for some reason, broke up with his girlfriend and started pursuing Victoria madly.
Every day, he sent flowers, food, and luxury goods non-stop, despite Victoria's constant rejections and polite indications that she wasn't interested in him.
But this guy was like velcro, impossible to shake off.
After the phone rang for a long time, it finally stopped.
Victoria breathed a sigh of relief.
Just as she was about to check the layout and decor of the hall for any needed adjustments, she saw Alton having someone carry 444 roses, standing in the center of the hall, shouting at her, "Victoria!"
Victoria was silent.
Everyone around was silent too.
"Oh my god, is this handsome guy confessing to this lady?"
"Of course! Who else would send 444 roses? It's so romantic!"
"So lucky!"
Victoria, however, didn't feel romantic or lucky at all.
She only felt extremely embarrassed.
She lowered her head, pretending not to see him, and used the blueprint to cover her face, wanting to leave this place quickly.
But the more she avoided him, the more persistent Alton became.
"Victoria! Victoria! The one in the brown coat, Victoria, look over here!" Alton waved his arms excitedly, shouting.
"Victoria, why don't you go over and talk to him?" Wendy teased, having heard the commotion, her eyes sparkling with anticipation to see Victoria's reaction.
Victoria glared at her and walked over helplessly.
"Victoria, do you like these roses?" Alton smiled brightly, showing his white teeth.
Victoria was overwhelmed by the strong floral scent and sneezed.
She quickly covered her nose, "Mr. Bridges, I can't accept these flowers, I'm really sorry."
"Don't be like that!" Alton looked at her with a face full of grievance, "I really like you."
Victoria sighed, "I'm sorry, you're not my type. Please give up."
Alton was stunned, then asked, "What type do you like?"
Victoria thought for a moment and decided to use Samuel's standards, "I like mature, steady, gentlemanly types who also appreciate art like I do."
And her words were all overheard by William, who was there with Alice to pick out furniture.

chapters.title: Chapter 66
chapters.content:
Alice moved into The Scott Villa.
But her home was filled with minimalist gray furniture.
It didn't match Alice at all.
Who would have thought there would be such a big drama?
She liked mature and steady types?
Is she talking about Samuel?
William's eyes narrowed slightly, and he unconsciously tightened his grip on Alice's hand.
"Ouch!" Alice exclaimed softly, complaining in pain, "William, you're hurting me."
William snapped back to reality and realized he almost hurt Alice. He immediately let go and apologized, "I'm sorry, Alice."
"It's okay, I don't blame you," Alice said sweetly.
Then, she discreetly looked at Victoria, who was standing in front of the roses, blushing from their fragrance.
Victoria was wearing a black cropped wool sweater with jeans, a brown coat over it, her long hair tied up in a high ponytail, revealing her slender neck, looking particularly bright and dazzling.
Seeing her like this, a dark shadow flashed in Alice's eyes.
Victoria.
Alton felt a bit disappointed hearing Victoria's response.
But he didn't give up; instead, he became more determined and expressed his thoughts, "Victoria, although I can't be the way you like right now, I will work hard. Just wait and see!"
With that, he turned and ran off.
Leaving Victoria speechless, staring at the enormous bouquet of roses.
Victoria was worrying about how to handle the flowers when Wendy whispered in her ear, "Victoria, look over there, who is that?"
Following Wendy's gaze, Victoria saw William in a dark casual suit, looking relaxed.
He was holding the hand of Alice, who looked like a fairy tale princess.
They were a perfect match.
In Victoria's memory, she had never seen William shopping.
It seemed he was accompanying Alice to pick out furniture today.
He was really thoughtful.
And now, Alice no longer looked as pale and haggard as when she first saw her in the hospital.
Her face had a healthy rosy glow, and she wore a sweet, shy smile.
It seemed William was taking good care of her.
Seeing her radiant appearance, Victoria couldn't help but think of Ella's weak and miserable state in the hospital.
She remembered the hideous and terrifying wounds on her body.
And now, her sister Alice was holding her ex-fiancé's hand, looking sweet and happy.
The stark contrast left Victoria in a daze.
When she came back to her senses, William had already walked past her with Alice, expressionless.
Victoria stood there in a daze for a long time.
Until Wendy nudged her, "Victoria, are you okay?"
Victoria snapped back to reality and shook her head, "I'm fine. I was just thinking about how to handle all these roses."
Wendy looked at the crowd gathering around and suggested, "How about we make a rose display? After all, it's bought by a client's son, so it's reasonable to use it."
Victoria nodded in agreement, she had the same idea.
So Victoria and Wendy started arranging the roses.
William took Alice around the building.
The furniture here was all from internationally renowned brands, expensive and exquisite.
Alice liked a sheepskin sofa, soft and comfortable to touch, with a thick handmade blanket on it, which should be quite warm to lie on.
But it was a bit pricey, with a three-seater sofa priced at over a million dollars.
Alice hesitated upon hearing the price.
"William, is this sofa really that expensive?" she was a bit reluctant.
William lovingly patted Alice's head and bought it for her with a swipe of his card, smiling at Alice, "Whatever you like, I'll get it for you."
Alice was moved and threw herself into his arms, complaining, "William, you're so good to me. When I was in Valados, I lived in shabby apartments."
Hearing this, William tightened his arm around her soft waist and said in a deep voice, "You're the daughter of the Garcia family, and they treated you like that?"
Alice nodded, biting her lip, her eyes slightly red, "I don't blame them. The tuition at Valados is so expensive. It's good enough that they paid for my tuition. As for living expenses, I could earn them by working."
"You had to work to earn money?" William frowned, "Why didn't you tell me?"
Alice looked up at him with her watery eyes, pitifully, "Ella sacrificed so much for me. How could I complain to you behind her back? Besides, I didn't want you to worry about me."
William looked at Alice, suddenly at a loss for words.
After a while, he slowly said, "If you have any difficulties in the future, you must tell me."
Alice's face lit up with a joyful smile, "Okay!"
After chatting for a while, William picked out a few more pieces of furniture she liked, then took her hand and walked towards the door.
Victoria and Wendy found an empty spot in the hall, laid down a thick carpet, and arranged the roses neatly.
Finally, they set up a beautiful crystal glass roof over it.
Bathed in warm yellow light, the rose carpet seemed as splendid and fantastical as a dreamland.
"So beautiful!" Wendy exclaimed.
Victoria liked it too.
Their hard work was worth it.
As they admired the rose display, someone suddenly shouted, "Are you Victoria?"
Victoria turned her head.
She saw a young girl in a pink and purple winter dress, carrying a sheepskin handbag, with light makeup, glaring at her with eyes full of anger.
"You know me?"
Victoria was puzzled.
Sofia snorted coldly, "Of course I know you, Victoria. You're the one who seduced my boyfriend!"
Victoria frowned, about to say something.
Wendy was furious, "Who are you, crazy girl? What nonsense are you talking about?"
"Who I am is none of your business, but I can guarantee that Victoria is a flirt who seduces men everywhere!"
"You!" Wendy was so angry she couldn't speak.
Victoria stopped the furious Wendy, calmly looking at Sofia, and asked, "Who are you? If you don't tell me, I'll call the police."
"You dare ask who I am?" Sofia pointed at her, "Because of you, my boyfriend broke up with me."

chapters.title: Chapter 67
chapters.content:
"Who is your boyfriend? Please make it clear." Victoria raised an eyebrow and asked.
"My boyfriend is Alton. Stop playing dumb with me!" Sofia pointed at her angrily, as if she wanted to tear her apart.
Victoria was speechless, feeling a sense of helplessness.
"You misunderstood, I'm not familiar with Alton at all, and I don't like him." Victoria patiently explained, "Your breakup has nothing to do with me."
"Bullshit!"
"Stop making excuses here!" Sofia pointed at her and cursed, "You bitch, do you think I don't know who you are? Your dad designed a bridge that collapsed and killed dozens of people, and you're no better. You're just a slut who steals others' job opportunities by selling yourself, and you even seduce a rich guy who already has a fiancée. You're the worst of the worst, shameless!"
The onlookers were shocked and looked at Victoria in disbelief. They didn't expect such a seemingly innocent girl to have such a messy private life.
Some even took out their phones to secretly film the scene.
Upon hearing this, Victoria's deep eyes narrowed, and a cold light flashed.
She looked coldly at the aggressive Sofia and questioned in a cold voice, "Miss, do you have any evidence? If not, don't blame me for suing you for defamation!"
"You!"
"I advise you to leave quickly, or when the security comes, you won't be able to leave even if you want to."
"I'm not leaving. I must expose you! I want to see what qualifications you have to stay here!"
Victoria couldn't be bothered to deal with her.
"Wendy, let's go." Victoria pulled Wendy and walked around Sofia towards the exit.
Sofia panicked and rushed forward, blocking their way.
She pointed at Victoria and shouted, "Stop! Did I say you could leave?"
Victoria frowned and looked at her displeased, asking, "What do you want now?"
"You must promise me today to cut off all contact with Alton immediately! Otherwise..." she threatened viciously.
Victoria couldn't help but laugh bitterly, "Are you out of your mind? I already told you I'm not familiar with him. Do you not understand human language?"
"You!" Sofia was furious and raised her hand to slap Victoria.
But before she could touch Victoria, Wendy grabbed her wrist and looked at her disdainfully, "Do you have rabies? Barking and hitting people here! If you're sick, go get treated, don't go crazy outside."
With that, she pulled Victoria's hand and walked away.
Sofia was trembling with anger. Suddenly, she saw a tiger head ornament nearby, grabbed it without thinking, and threw it at Victoria while screaming, "You bitch! I'll kill you!"
Victoria was caught off guard and hit directly.
A sharp pain shot through her arm.
"Victoria! Are you okay?" Wendy was terrified.
Seeing this, Sofia laughed hysterically and even wanted to pick up another tiger head to throw at Victoria.
Suddenly, a hand grabbed her wrist and twisted it forcefully.
Sofia screamed in pain, feeling as if her entire arm was dislocated. She cried out in pain, tears almost streaming down her face.
"You bitch..."
Victoria endured the severe pain in her shoulder and looked up to see William with a grim face, throwing Sofia to the ground. 
A crisp sound echoed through the hall.
William slapped her so hard that half of her face swelled up.
Sofia was stunned.
Victoria was also stunned.
William's cold gaze swept over the disheveled Sofia on the ground, then he turned to Victoria and asked in a deep voice, "Are you okay?"
Victoria held her shoulder and shook her head blankly.
She couldn't believe William to slap Sofia to defend her, which was beyond her expectations.
Seeing this, William's expression softened slightly. He helped Victoria sit on the sofa and said gently, "Sit down and rest for a while."
Victoria was dazed for a moment before she responded softly.
At this time, Wendy snapped out of her shock. She quickly approached Victoria and asked concernedly, "Victoria, how's your injury?"
Victoria shook her head, "It's okay, I'm fine."
Sofia got up from the ground, covering her face, and looked hatefully at the cold William who had suddenly appeared and hit her. She cried, "Are you also this woman's lover? I'm telling you, she's a slut who sleeps around. Don't be fooled by her pitiful appearance!"
"Shut up!" William scolded, his icy voice filled with murderous intent.
Sofia shivered but still shouted fearlessly, "Why are you so fierce? Am I wrong? She's a slut, a bitch!"
William's eyes turned cold, and he didn't want to waste any more words with her. He directly called the police.
"I just hit her once, and you hit me back. It's just a small matter, and you're calling the police? Who are you trying to scare?" Sofia sneered and then turned to Victoria, "Alton's family will never accept you someone like you. I advise you to give up early!"
"Have you said enough?" Wendy couldn't stand it anymore. She grabbed Sofia's hair and shook it hard, "Do you believe I'll hit you?"
Soon, the police arrived.
After investigating the surveillance and testimonies of the people around, Sofia was taken away for causing trouble.
Everything would be decided after Victoria's injury report came out.
Victoria wanted to take a cab to the hospital, but William stopped her with a look.
"Come with me!" he ordered coldly.
Victoria pursed her lips and obediently followed him to the parking lot.
Alice was already waiting in the car.
She sat in the passenger seat and greeted her with a gentle smile, "Ms. Carter."
Victoria nodded politely, "Hello, Ms. Garcia."
William glanced at her and sat directly in the driver's seat.
Victoria hesitated for a moment but eventually sat in the back seat.
As soon as the car door closed, a faint fragrance wafted into her nose. Victoria instinctively frowned but didn't show it.
She had always been somewhat allergic to perfume. William's car never had a perfume smell before.
It must be coming from Alice.
Victoria lowered her eyes and leaned against the car window, holding her arm and resting.
The car drove steadily forward, and Alice and William discussed how to arrange the furniture they had just bought.
William listened patiently and occasionally offered suggestions.
So they were already living together?
Victoria had never seen him so gentle before, and she couldn't help but feel a bit dazed.
Even with Ella, William never seemed so gentle and careful.
It seemed more like he was performing for the fiancée's title, without much genuine affection.
But Victoria could easily see the genuine affection he held for Alice in his eyes-a palpable adoration that betrayed the depth of his feelings.
True love, perhaps, was meant to describe this situation.
It was undoubtedly true love.
Victoria felt a strange bitterness in her heart, but what followed was relief and release.
He already had true love, so he would let her go, right?
"Ms. Carter, the boy who sent you roses is quite nice. You might want to consider him," Alice suddenly joked lightly.

chapters.title: Chapter 68
chapters.content:
She had a serene and elegant demeanor, always wearing a faint smile when she spoke.
This was what a true lady of a noble family should be like;⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ she exuded grace and elegance in every gesture, and her words carried a sense of intimacy and ease that made people feel very comfortable.
Ella, who always spoke with hidden sarcasm, was completely unlike a young lady raised in a wealthy family.
It was said that Willow was a mistress who climbed her way up, so it's no wonder Ella behaved like that. 
Thinking of this, she looked up and gave Alice a friendly smile, "Thank you for Ms. Garcia's suggestion, but I don't have any plans to date anyone at the moment."
"That's really a pity," Alice sighed lightly, then added, "Ms. Carter is so beautiful, no wonder that girl is so jealous of you; she has lost all sense of reason."
"That girl looks like she's from a wealthy family, why would she be jealous of someone like me?" Victoria said with a bitter smile.
Although she knew Alice was complimenting her, such flattery felt somewhat ironic to a loser.
Hearing her words, William's grip on the steering wheel tightened slightly.
The hospital wasn't far, and they arrived quickly.
Victoria quickly got out of the car and immediately said to the two still in the car, "Thank you, Mr. Scott and Ms. Garcia, I'll just go get some medicine myself, you two take care on the way." With that, she didn't wait for their response and quickly ran into the hospital building.
William watched her back, his expression complex as he withdrew his gaze.
Then he turned the car around and headed home.
Alice looked at William, whose face didn't look too good, and tentatively asked, "William, do you like Victoria?"
As soon as she finished speaking, William suddenly slammed on the brakes.
The screeching sound of the tires against the ground startled Alice.
"Did I say something wrong?" she blinked timidly.
William frowned deeply and stared at her, "Don't let your imagination run wild!"
Alice chuckled lightly, "William, you know, when a man says a woman is imagining things, it usually means the woman guessed right, but because she has no evidence, the man thinks he can get away with it."
William's handsome face turned gloomy, "You know about her and me?"
The smile on Alice's face gradually faded, and after a moment of silence, she sighed softly, "William, I've been gone for so many years, it's natural that you couldn't stay faithful to me. But now that I'm back, I hope you won't get entangled with her anymore, okay?"
William's eyes were deep as the sea, and after a moment, he replied, "I've already made things clear with her, don't worry."
Hearing his words, Alice smiled again, reached out to tug at William's sleeve, and said sweetly, "I believe William won't lie to me."
William nodded and reached out to ruffle her hair.
Alice squinted her eyes in satisfaction, her smile sweet.
William drove her to the restaurant she had been looking forward to.
During the meal, he received a text from his lawyer, asking how he wanted to handle the situation.
William replied simply and decisively with just a few words: [Let her go to jail.]
Sofia, who hit Victoria, had a father, Lloyd Moore, who was a high-ranking executive at a bank. She had been pampered and spoiled since childhood, which made her arrogant and domineering.
Who knew she would find a boyfriend who dumped her for a small-time employee.
Sofia couldn't swallow her anger and immediately investigated Victoria's background.
She discovered that Victoria had a notorious reputation.
Her father Alvin was in prison, and she herself had been involved in scandals for allegedly using her body to climb the social ladder.
There were even rumors that she had an unclear relationship with a big shot who had a fiancée.
Being dumped for someone like that, of course, Sofia was unhappy.
She went directly to cause trouble, which led to the current situation.
It wasn't until she was locked up in the police station's detention center that she started to get scared.
She kept begging the police to let her out.
Her parents had always doted on Sofia and couldn't bear to see her suffer.
So they asked a familiar lawyer to smooth things over at the police station.
Initially, Sofia's parents thought it was just a petty rivalry between girls, and since Sofia had also been hit, it shouldn't be a big deal. At worst, they would just pay some money.
But the lawyer told them that the matter was far-reaching, and there was a big shot involved, making it impossible to bail her out.
They panicked and sought help from many people, but to no avail.
After three days of Sofia's detention, they finally found out that the person Sofia had hit was William's woman.
What kind of existence is the Scott family?
The top conglomerate in Crystalia, capable of shaking the entire city with a single move.
Lloyd was just an ordinary bank executive and couldn't afford to provoke them.
Sofia's mother, Thalia Moore, cried her eyes out, while Lloyd was worried sick.
Lloyd, who usually looked shrewd, now had gray hair and a troubled expression.
Finally, their lawyer suggested they seek help from Alton to plead with the victim.
As long as the victim agreed, everything would be resolved.
Since the matter started because of him, and seeing Lloyd and Thalia's sincere pleas, Alton hesitated for a moment and agreed to help, despite his embarrassment at facing Victoria again.
Victoria then learned that Sofia had been detained for three days.
And no one knew how much longer she would be held.
It seemed William wanted her to go to jail.
She didn't expect William to care so much about her being hit.
Although the tiger head had indeed swollen her arm, it wasn't serious enough to warrant jail time.
After thinking it over, she decided to call William.
William was about to drive home when he received her call.
"Mr. Scott," Victoria's tone was calm.
"What is it?" William asked.
Victoria hesitated for a moment before saying, "Sofia has been detained for three days."
There was silence on the other end of the line for a few seconds.
William's deep, magnetic voice slowly sounded, "So?"
Victoria bit her lip and hesitated for a moment before saying, "Mr. Scott, I think it would be better to settle this privately. She's only 19, still a young girl. If she's sentenced, her life could be ruined."
William raised an eyebrow, his tone mocking, "Are you saying I'm being too harsh?"
Victoria was stunned for a moment and quickly denied, "Of course not, you're standing up for me. I'm not ungrateful. I just think that making a big deal out of this isn't good for either of us, especially since my reputation isn't great to begin with."
After listening, William's lips curled into a cold smile, and he scoffed, "Victoria, you're still so hypocritical."
With that, he hung up the phone.

chapters.title: Chapter 69
chapters.content:
Victoria heard the phone click, paused for a moment, and then suddenly gave a helpless smile.
Of course, she didn't want to let it go just like that.
Sofia insulted her in front of so many people and even injured her, just because her family background was better than hers, right?
If she just let it go, wouldn't that mean she was easy to bully and let others trample on her?
But what could she do?
Ever since Alvin had his accident, there was no one to protect her anymore.
And she didn't know if William helped her this time because he truly felt sorry for her injury or just because he was provoked.
Moreover, he already had Alice by his side now.
If she didn't let it go now, what would happen when William decided to leave her alone in the future? Who would stand up for her then?
The more Victoria thought about it, the more humiliated she felt. She buried her head in the pillow, her eyes slightly red.
After a while, she got up from the bed and called Samuel.
Because her arm was injured, she couldn't go to the studio to paint with Samuel on Saturday.
When Samuel received her call, he was a bit worried. "Victoria, are you sick?"
Victoria didn't want him to worry, so she chose to hide the truth. "No, I've just been really busy lately."
Samuel was stunned for a moment, then smiled bitterly. "Victoria, even after all this time, you still keep your distance from me."
Hearing this, Victoria felt a pang in her heart, and her eyes couldn't help but moisten.
She sniffed, trying hard to control her emotions. "I'm fine, just a bit tired lately. I'll be okay after some rest."
Samuel pondered for a moment and then gently advised. "If you need anything, remember to tell me. There's no need for formalities between us."
Victoria bit her lip and nodded. "Okay, thank you, Samuel."
At William's command, Sofia was released.
That night, the Moore family called, wanting to bring Sofia to apologize to Victoria in person, and of course, they also invited William to attend.
Lloyd and Thalia were humble and extremely polite.
Victoria initially refused, but couldn't resist Thalia's persistent persuasion, moved by her motherly love, and finally agreed to attend the dinner.
At 7:30 PM, Victoria arrived on time.
As she reached the hotel entrance, a black Maybach stopped in front of her.
The driver got out and opened the rear door.
A man in a suit and tie, exuding an air of nobility, stepped out of the car.
He looked at Victoria with deep eyes, as if they contained a thousand mountains covered in snow.
William walked towards her, and their eyes met, both showing complex emotions.
After a long while, William hoarsely called out, "Victoria."
Victoria sighed lightly and looked away first. "Mr. Scott."
William glanced at her arm, his eyes darkening. "How's your arm?"
Victoria nodded, lowering her eyes slightly, and said self-deprecatingly. "I've become a regular at the hospital. This little injury is no big deal."
Hearing her say that, William felt a surge of inexplicable anger. "No big deal? Then what do you consider a big deal?"
Victoria was stunned, not understanding why he suddenly got angry, and remained silent.
William stared at her for a moment, then suddenly sneered. "I forgot how tough you are, just like how shameless you can be!"
After saying that, he walked past her and headed into the hotel.
Victoria stood there for a long time before slowly reacting.
He actually called her shameless!
How dare he insult her? How dare he?
Victoria felt a tightness in her chest, a breath of anger stuck in her throat.
She clenched her fists, holding back her anger, and caught up with William.
When they opened the door to the private room, the Moore family and Alton all stood up.
Sofia, having been detained for a few days, was much more subdued, but Victoria could tell she was still full of resentment.
Alton glanced at Victoria with some embarrassment, then lowered his head in fear of William beside her.
If he had known she was William's woman, he wouldn't have dared to provoke her.
Lloyd awkwardly smiled. "Mr. Scott, you're here, please have a seat."
William, with a cold expression, sat down in the center, while Victoria sat to his left.
Once everyone was seated, Lloyd eagerly raised his glass to Victoria. "Ms. Carter, this incident was all because Sofia was young and ignorant..."
Before Victoria could speak, William interrupted Lloyd. "Young? Victoria is less than a year older than your daughter. Is she not young?"
Lloyd awkwardly closed his mouth.
If he hadn't mentioned it, no one would have thought Victoria was so young.
Because she no longer had that youthful naivety, but rather a mature and composed demeanor.
Lloyd carefully continued. "Sofia has realized her mistake. Ms. Carter, I brought her here today to apologize to you, hoping you can forgive her."
Victoria looked at Sofia, who seemed composed and not at all remorseful.
She glanced at her briefly, then turned to Lloyd and calmly replied, "Mr. Moore, it wasn't you who did it. There's no need for you to apologize to me."
William, amused by her assertiveness, chimed in. "Exactly, if the person who made the mistake doesn't apologize, then let's just forget it."
Sofia slammed the table, her eyes wide with anger, and accused. "I just hit you once, and you had me detained for so many days. Now you're turning the tables on me. Do you have any sense of reason?"
"What did you say?" William narrowed his eyes dangerously.
Victoria placed a hand on his arm, signaling him to stay calm.
Victoria looked up at Sofia, her clear eyes flashing with cold light. "It seems Ms. Moore doesn't think she did anything wrong. In that case, there's no need to continue this dinner."
"You!" Sofia's face changed, clenching her fists in anger.
Lloyd frowned and quickly tried to smooth things over. "Ms. Carter, it's a misunderstanding. Sofia didn't mean it that way."
He sincerely said. "Ms. Carter, this is all my fault for not educating her properly. Please be magnanimous and let's just forget this ever happened."
"Dad, why are you begging her? She just wants to extort more money." Sofia said indignantly, full of sarcasm, then turned to Victoria, "Tell me, how much do you want? The Moore family can afford it. Name your price!"
Victoria was shocked by Sofia's shamelessness.
She had come to this dinner just to get an apology, but Sofia insulted her like this.
And judging by Lloyd and Thalia's expressions, they didn't seem to oppose her actions.
To them, she was just here to get compensation.
Victoria smirked, looking at Sofia with a half-smile. "Sofia, I'm afraid you can't afford the compensation I want."
"How much do you want?" Sofia looked at her disdainfully.
Victoria curled her lips and slowly said. "One billion dollars."
Sofia burst into laughter, pointing at Victoria with an exaggerated expression. "Are you crazy? Do you know how much a billion dollars is?"

chapters.title: Chapter 70
chapters.content:
Victoria calmly sipped her tea, "Didn't you say I could name my price? What? Backing out already? If that's the case, then I guess I came here for nothing."
Lloyd quickly interjected, "Ms. Carter, Sofia is still a child and doesn't know any better. Please don't hold it against her."
He kept signaling Sofia to apologize.
Unfortunately, Sofia didn't appreciate it and instead directed all her anger at Victoria.
"Who 's backing out? You're the one making outrageous demands!"
Victoria raised an eyebrow, "If you can't afford it, that's fine. You don't need to apologize. You injured my arm, so let me hit you until I'm satisfied, and I'll let Mr. Scott drop the matter. How about that?"
"You! You're too much!" Sofia's eyes turned red, and she started to cry, "You're bullying me!"
Victoria's face remained indifferent, "My terms are fair."
Thalia, seeing Sofia crying in anger, quickly tried to comfort her, "Sofia, don't cry."
She turned her head and glared at Victoria, "Ms. Carter, asking for a hundred million dollars is unreasonable. We're sincerely trying to resolve this matter with you, so there's no need to be so aggressive."
Lloyd, despite his fear of William, couldn't help but get a little angry, "Ms. Carter, as far as I know, you're just a small employee at a gallery, living off your salary, with a sick mother and a brother still in school to support. Name a realistic number, and don't make things difficult."
Alton, seeing the tense atmosphere, wanted to say something in Victoria's defense but chose to remain silent because William was present.
Victoria chuckled softly, a hint of self-mockery in her eyes.
It seemed that, in the eyes of the Moore family, everything she did was just to get more money.
To these wealthy people, anything that could be solved with money was not a big issue.
But if you wanted to harm their noble bodies, that was a great insult.
They never considered that while their bodies could feel pain, so could others'.
Rich people had dignity, and so did poor people.
Victoria's hand on her knee clenched slightly. She took a deep breath, trying to suppress the anger about to erupt, and said calmly, "You can't come up with the money, and you don't want me to hurt your precious body, so there's nothing more to say."
With that, she stood up to leave.
William grabbed her hand, pressing her back into the chair, and extinguished his cigarette in the ashtray.
His eyes were dark, and his voice was cold, "Do as she says. Let her hit your daughter until she's satisfied."
William's tone was calm, but the underlying menace and ruthlessness were terrifying.
As soon as he spoke, the temperature in the restaurant seemed to drop several degrees.
Sofia trembled in fear, almost collapsing to the floor.
She stammered, "No... no way!"
Thalia panicked, "Mr. Scott!"
William glanced at them mockingly, "I understand you want to protect your daughter, but I also have to protect my woman. It's either a beating or jail. You choose. I'll give you a day to think about it."
With that, he took Victoria's hand and walked out of the private room.
Sofia stood there in shock for a moment before rushing to the door, only to be stopped by the bodyguards waiting outside.
"Mr. Scott, please listen to me. Give me another chance. I was wrong. I really know I was wrong."
But William didn't stop, walking straight out.
Victoria followed beside him, her head down, feeling conflicted.
Lloyd's words echoed in her mind, reminding her of the times Alvin had defended her.
She kept her head down, ignoring William's increasingly tight grip on her hand.
In the car, the warm air from the air conditioner blew gently. William looked out the window at the passing neon lights, his expression unreadable.
Victoria pressed her lips together, saying nothing.
Suddenly, William turned his head, staring at her profile, and asked softly, "What's wrong?"
Victoria's eyelashes fluttered slightly, and she slowly shook her head.
"Don't let their crazy talk get to you." William's voice was magnetic and low.
Victoria pressed her lips together, "Thank you for helping me."
If it weren't for him, she would have had to swallow the insults and injuries in silence.
It seemed he wasn't as bad as she thought.
"To hear a 'thank you' from you is quite rare," William scoffed.
Victoria ignored his mockery and continued, "That Sofia is still young. Just give her a little lesson. Even if she let me hit her, I couldn't do it."
William narrowed his eyes, "What? Feeling soft-hearted?"
Victoria paused, raising her clear, bright eyes to look at him seriously, "It's not soft-hearted. I just think her parents have it tough."
"you're kind-hearted but foolish, always letting useless people bully you," William said nonchalantly.
Victoria pressed her lips together and said nothing more.
William smirked, then leaned back in his seat and closed his eyes to rest.
After a while, Victoria's phone rang.
She glanced at the number; it was Samuel calling.
Victoria looked at William, hesitated for two seconds, and answered the call.
"Victoria, my parents are here. They want to invite you to dinner the day after tomorrow. Can you come?" Samuel warmly invited over the phone.
Victoria glanced at William, who was resting with his eyes closed, turned her head, and lowered her voice, "Okay."
After hanging up, she looked at William. He still had his eyes closed, showing no reaction. She let out a long breath.
It seemed that once Alice returned, he really wouldn't bother her anymore.
Thinking this, she felt much more at ease. A faint smile appeared on her lips as she tucked a stray lock of hair behind her ear, looking even more gentle and pure.
William opened his eyes just in time to catch this moment.
His heart sank, and even his breathing became difficult.
Was she that happy to meet Samuel's parents?
What was so good about that old man?
What was she so happy about?
He narrowed his eyes, a strange feeling spreading in his heart, tinged with a bit of sourness and helplessness.
Victoria sensed William's gaze and immediately returned to her usual self.
William suppressed his emotions, placed his hand on the armrest, and said lightly, "I just remembered I have something to do at the office. You'll have to take a cab home."

chapters.title: Chapter 71
chapters.content:
Victoria was taken aback and nodded in agreement.
William asked Harry to pull the car over to the side of the road. After Victoria got out, the car immediately drove away.
Victoria stood still, looked up at the pitch-black night sky, sighed deeply, and walked towards the bus stop.
On the day she had arranged to meet Samuel, Victoria worked all day despite the pain in her arm.
Samuel was already waiting for her outside the Starry Studio Gallery in his car.
She tidied up her clothes and makeup, then hurried over with her bag.
Today, Samuel was wearing an off-white suit, his hair neatly combed, making him look both refined and elegant.
He opened the car door and got out, walking towards Victoria.
Victoria was about to greet him when suddenly someone jumped out from the side and grabbed her hand.
She was startled and instinctively shook off the person.
Upon closer inspection, she realized it was Sofia.
"Ms. Moore, what do you want now?" she frowned.
Samuel frowned slightly and stepped forward, standing protectively beside Victoria.
Sofia's cheeks were red, as if she had been crying, looking pitiful and tearful.
"Ms. Carter, I'm here to apologize to you. I'm sorry, I was too impulsive before. I hope you can be forgiving and not hold a grudge against my previous offense."
She spoke humbly, without a trace of arrogance.
Victoria frowned, "What do you mean by this?"
Such a drastic change in attitude in just one day made Victoria worry that Sofia might have some ulterior motive.
Samuel, standing beside her, remained silent, his usually gentle face now somewhat gloomy, revealing nothing of his thoughts.
Sofia wiped her tears and pulled at her clothes, revealing a bruised shoulder.
"Ms. Carter, this was done by Mr. Scott's men."
"Are you here to settle scores with me?" Victoria raised an eyebrow.
"No, I'm here to apologize." She bit her lip, forcing a smile, "I was blinded by jealousy before and did something foolish. Now I've come to my senses and want to apologize to you in person."
As she spoke, she bowed deeply.
Victoria was slightly stunned by her actions.
Such behavior didn't seem like an act of revenge.
But she didn't believe Sofia's words and remained cautious, "Ms. Moore, I don't care what your intentions are today, but I advise you not to have any bad ideas!"
"I really know I was wrong!" Sofia said urgently.
Her attitude was sincere, her eyes red, looking extremely aggrieved. "I heard from my father that Mr. Scott originally intended to have me imprisoned for a year and a half. Fortunately, Ms. Carter, you didn't hold a grudge, and Mr. Scott showed mercy and released me early!"
After speaking, she bowed again, this time genuinely.
Victoria was very surprised.
She didn't expect William to reveal her plea to the Moore family.
This not only vented her anger but also made the Moore family owe her a favor.
"Ms. Carter, you saved my life. Without you, I would have been ruined forever."
She choked and sobbed.
Victoria pursed her lips, glanced at Sofia, and then looked away, "I've received your apology. Let's leave it at that."
With that, she signaled to Samuel, who was waiting nearby, and prepared to get in the car and leave.
Sofia grabbed her again and handed her a card, "Ms. Carter, there's $200,000 in here. It's not much, but it's a token of my appreciation."
Victoria glanced at the bank card but didn't take it, "You've been hurt and apologized to me. We're even. Keep the money."
"No, no, this is my token of appreciation! Please, you must accept it!" Sofia held her hand tightly, her eyes red.
Victoria was about to refuse when Samuel suddenly spoke up, "Victoria, accept it. If you don't, she probably won't be at ease."
Samuel emphasized "at ease," and Sofia immediately echoed, "Ms. Carter, please accept it!"
Victoria hesitated for a few seconds before finally agreeing, "Alright, I'll accept it."
Sofia was overjoyed, "Thank you, Ms. Carter!"
After sending Sofia away, Victoria got into the car.
Samuel hadn't spoken since getting in.
Victoria had never seen him so serious before. She pursed her lips and tentatively called out, "Samuel?"
Samuel turned his head, his gaze falling on her slightly pale face.
After a moment, he spoke slowly, "Victoria, you told me before that you couldn't come to paint because your arm was injured by that girl, right?"
Victoria was stunned for a few seconds before quickly coming to her senses.
She nodded, "Yes."
"I should have guessed." He murmured, a hint of helplessness in his eyes.
Even after all this time, Victoria still hadn't thought of relying on him.
She could accept William's money and help, but she wouldn't owe him anything.
She said she didn't want to trouble him, but in reality, she was just keeping her distance.
Even someone as confident as Samuel felt a sense of defeat at this moment.
"Victoria, I actually mind a little." He looked out the window, his tone serious, "In the future, learn to rely on me, okay?"
Victoria's body trembled, and she turned to look at him.
His handsome and refined face was full of gentleness and care.
He asked her to learn to rely on me in the future.
A faint smile appeared on her lips, but her eyes glistened with tears, "Okay."
Samuel smiled, "Good girl."
As he spoke, he patted her head, "I know what you're worried about. Don't be afraid. With me here, no one can bully you."
Victoria's nose tingled, and she softly called out, "Samuel."
Her voice was hoarse and indistinct, as if filled with a thick nasal tone.
Samuel just patted her back and didn't say anything more.
The car fell silent, with only the sound of the engine running.
The car stopped at an estate.
This was the largest garden-themed restaurant in Silvermist City, called 'Aroma Garden Eatery.'
Victoria sat nervously across from Samuel's parents, feeling anxious.
She couldn't help but wonder what they would think of her.
"Dad, Mom, this is Victoria," Samuel introduced.
Victoria quickly stood up and respectfully said, "Mr. Brown, Mrs. Brown, nice to meet you."
Samuel's mother, Primrose Brown, looked Victoria up and down, nodding in satisfaction.
Other families already had grandchildren, but Samuel, almost thirty, showed no signs of getting married or even having a girlfriend.
Talking to him was useless; he had been independent since childhood and wouldn't let anyone interfere. 
Although Victoria's family background and education weren't impressive, she was beautiful and young. They could teach and nurture her slowly.
If they missed this opportunity, they might never find someone Samuel liked, and he would end up alone.
Thinking this, Primrose's face was full of smiles, "Sit here, let's not be formal."
Primrose warmly invited Victoria to sit and asked the waiter to bring the menu.
"Victoria, order whatever you like. Don't be shy."
Victoria felt a bit uneasy and quickly declined, "Mrs. Brown, you're too kind."
Seeing Victoria's discomfort, Samuel took the menu and ordered some of their favorite dishes.
The atmosphere at the table became lively.
Victoria was a bit overwhelmed. She hadn't expected Primrose to be so easygoing and to like her so much.
During the meal, Primrose kept serving her food, and Samuel's father, Elmer Brown, though not very talkative, was also very kind.
They treated her as if she were already their daughter-in-law.
They even discussed whether to live in Prosperity City or Silvermist City in the future.
This made Victoria very uncomfortable.
She explained that she and Samuel were not yet in a relationship, "Mr. Brown, Mrs. Brown, actually, Samuel and I..."

chapters.title: Chapter 72
chapters.content:
She didn't finish her sentence before Samuel stuffed a shrimp into her mouth. "Victoria, you like this, eat more."
Victoria looked at him and swallowed the words that were on the tip of her tongue.
Better to talk about it later.
At that moment, a couple walked past them.
Elmer immediately recognized that it was William from the Scott family.
The Scott Group was currently the Brown family's top partner, so Elmer quickly stood up to greet him. "William!"
Victoria followed his gaze and saw that it was indeed William and Alice.
The two stopped and looked over at them.
Seeing Victoria with her head down, a cold smile appeared on William's lips.
William squinted his eyes and turned to Elmer, nodding politely. "Mr. Brown, you're here too."
Elmer chuckled. "We're having a family meal here."
"A family meal?" William glanced at the uneasy Victoria and the man next to her, Samuel, raising his eyebrows. "How lovely!"
Victoria's hands clenched under the table. She didn't know why William was here today.
Could it be that he heard her phone call with Samuel that day and came here specifically to confront her?
Her body trembled slightly, and just as she was about to say something, Samuel's hand suddenly held hers.
Victoria didn't want to overthink it, but the facts were right in front of her, and she couldn't help but think that way.
Victoria was startled and looked up, meeting Samuel's clear eyes.
He smiled at her, as if to reassure her, and then turned to William. "Thank you, Mr. Scott. Is this your girlfriend? She's very beautiful!"
Alice, who was holding William's arm, glanced at Victoria and tightened her grip a bit, seemingly shy as she replied softly, "Thank you for the compliment!"
"So you know each other!" Elmer was surprised.
Samuel nodded calmly. "We've met a few times."
William's deep eyes darkened slightly at his words.
"Since you know each other, why not join us for a meal?" Elmer invited warmly.
William smiled. "Thank you, Mr. Brown, but I'm afraid someone might feel uncomfortable. We won't disturb your 'family meal'!"
With that, he took Alice's hand and left the private room.
Elmer looked at the door, frowning. "Why do I feel like he's a bit unhappy?"
Samuel pondered for a moment and then said, "Maybe it's because his girlfriend is here."
Primrose nodded. "Indeed."
Victoria breathed a sigh of relief.
But she couldn't shake the feeling that this wasn't over.
After William left, the atmosphere gradually returned to its previous liveliness. Primrose chatted with Victoria, asking about many interesting things in her daily life.
Victoria answered each question humbly, and the more Primrose looked at her, the more she liked her, becoming increasingly enthusiastic.
Victoria felt a bit overwhelmed and stood up, wanting to go to the restroom to take a break.
Samuel noticed her discomfort and smiled at her, not insisting on following her, giving her some time to relax.
Aroma Garden Eatery was quite large, and Victoria couldn't find the restroom after looking around.
Instead, she ended up in the flower room where the restaurant kept fresh flowers.
The decor inside was elegant, with walls covered in various flowers, emitting a faint fragrance.
Victoria was allergic to perfume but had no resistance to natural flowers.
The roses Alton sent last time probably had perfume sprayed on them, which made her sneeze.
She couldn't help but walk closer to the flowers, reaching out to pick a pink rose and bringing it to her nose to sniff. The sweet fragrance lingered, making her feel inexplicably relaxed.
She put the rose back and was about to leave.
But then she saw William standing by the flower room, smoking. His handsome profile was shrouded in a hazy light, mysterious and sexy.
He looked up inadvertently, and their eyes met. Victoria quickly looked away, feeling guilty.
Victoria didn't dare to stay any longer and hurriedly tried to leave.
William extinguished his cigarette and strode over, blocking her path.
Victoria took two steps back in fright, staring at him warily. "What are you doing?"
"Are you avoiding me?" William raised an eyebrow.
Victoria pressed her lips together, ignoring him and continuing to walk forward.
William grabbed her wrist and pulled her into the flower room, locking the door behind them.
"Let go!" Victoria struggled.
William pinned her against the wall, looking down at her with dangerous eyes. "Are you avoiding me?"
Victoria gritted her teeth and stubbornly raised her head. "No."
"No?" William sneered, pressing her. "Then why are you so flustered?"
Victoria was speechless.
Yes, why was she flustered? He already had Alice, so she had no reason to worry about him entangling with her.
Seeing her silence, William's tone became severe. "Tell me!"
Victoria bit her lip, refusing to speak.
William's eyes darkened. "Victoria, don't tell me you're avoiding me because you're afraid Samuel will misunderstand?"
Victoria was stunned. She did want to avoid him, but not because of Samuel.
"Think whatever you want!" Victoria said, turning to leave.
William grabbed her waist and pulled her into his arms, his lips landing on her neck, biting hard.
Victoria groaned.
She could clearly smell the strong scent of alcohol on William.
"Let go!" Victoria elbowed his abdomen, trying to break free, but it was futile.
She had to resort to using her legs to attack him.
But before her leg could touch him, William pinned her down. His other hand covered her breast, kneading through the soft sweater.
Victoria trembled all over.
She was both anxious and angry. "Bastard, let go of me!"
"You better pray I don't find out you have any intimate relationship with Samuel," William's hoarse voice sounded.
His fingers lingered on her chest, seemingly wanting to go further.
Victoria's eyes widened in horror, and she shook her head desperately. "No!"
William put a finger to his lips, whispering, "Shut up, and don't move, or else..."
Before he finished speaking, he kissed her lips.
His warm tongue invaded her mouth, taking in her scent, dominating her territory, and savoring her sweetness.
Victoria felt like she was floating, her thoughts lost in William's fiery breath.
His lips were cool and moist, like poppies blooming on a rainy night.
He kissed her, his hand wandering over her body, teasing her.
After what felt like an eternity, William finally reluctantly left her lips, resting his forehead against hers, whispering, "Good girl."
His warm breath tickled her ear, making her body tingle and a strange sense of unfamiliarity rise within her.
Victoria could clearly feel his swollen erection pressing against her, the scorching heat transmitting through their clothes to her skin, making her whole body stiffen.
"Alice is still waiting for you," Victoria reminded him softly.

chapters.title: Chapter 73
chapters.content:
Hearing this name, William's eyes instantly regained clarity.
He furrowed his brows, withdrew from her, and gave her a deep look.
Then he straightened his clothes, pushed open the greenhouse door, and walked out.
Victoria panted slightly, a trace of sadness flashing in her eyes as she watched William's back.
She had almost lost control and entangled with him just now.
As William's figure disappeared from sight, Victoria composed herself and turned to leave.
Victoria walked towards the dining table and unexpectedly ran into Alice.
Alice looked at the flushed Victoria, and a trace of resentment flashed in her eyes.
She had come out looking for William.
He had said he was going out for a smoke but had been gone for a long time and hadn't returned.
Alice was worried that William might have encountered some accident while drunk, so she came out to find him.
Unexpectedly, she saw William kissing Victoria in the greenhouse, a passionate William she had never seen before.
The intimate scene almost drove her to collapse.
She had been living with him for so long, yet he had never touched her.
She always thought he respected her and cared for her body, so he was reluctant to touch her.
Now it seemed she was too naive.
Alice tightly gripped her phone, her nails digging into her flesh, seething with anger and wanting to kill.
But she held back; she wasn't a fool like Ella, who would get emotional and resort to violence at the slightest provocation.
Making a scene now would not benefit her at all.
She had long known about the relationship between Victoria and William.
But so what?
All men are dogs!
Just like Zachary, who used to dote on her mother but still cheated and had Ella, who was just a year younger than her.
After Alice's mother died, Zachary married Willow within three months.
But she could clearly feel that William had a special place for Victoria.
If she drove Victoria away tonight or quarreled with William because of her, she would be the one to suffer.
She would not allow this matter to escalate to an unbearable level.
Thinking of this, Alice put on a gentle smile and waved at Victoria, "Ms. Carter."
Victoria stopped and looked at Alice, feeling inexplicably guilty.
"Ms. Carter, have you seen William? I've been looking for him for a while," Alice asked, pretending to be calm.
Victoria cleared her throat and said softly, "I don't know. I just came out of the restroom and didn't see him."
Alice's eyes flickered, and she smiled, "If you didn't see him, then we must have missed each other."
Victoria nodded, said nothing more, and prepared to leave.
Alice called out to her, "By the way, my friend's bar is opening in a few days, and she wants me to bring some people to support her. I'm having trouble finding someone suitable. Why don't you come along? I promise to get you home safely after that, okay?"
Alice's words were accompanied by a gentle smile and a polite tone, making it hard to refuse.
Victoria hesitated for a moment but decided to decline.
She really didn't want to get involved with them any further.
"Sorry, I don't like lively places," Victoria replied tactfully.
"But I've already told Daisy you would come, and she was very happy. Are you sure you won't go? She would be very disappointed," Alice feigned disappointment.
Hearing this, Victoria hesitated.
Daisy had taken her to the hospital last time, and she hadn't thanked her yet.
"Since that's the case, I'll go," Victoria said.
Alice breathed a sigh of relief and smiled brightly, "Then it's settled. I'll send the address to your phone later, and I'll have a driver pick you up."
After saying this, Alice walked towards her seat.
Elmer and Primrose were very pleased with Victoria and even gave her a delicate jewelry box containing a beautiful diamond necklace when they left.
The necklace was a limited edition and very expensive.
"Ms. Carter, I had this specially designed for you. It will look beautiful on you."
"Thank you so much, but it's too valuable. I can't accept it," Victoria declined.
Primrose took her hand and said, "We are elders, and you can't refuse a gift from us. Take it!"
Victoria couldn't refuse Elmer and Primrose, so she looked at Samuel for help, hoping he would persuade them.
Samuel smiled and said, "Take it. If you don't accept my mom's choice, she will be unhappy."
Victoria had no choice but to accept the jewelry box.
At this moment, William also came out with Alice, seemingly not seeing them, and left through another exit.
But Victoria felt that his parting glance carried a chill, making her shiver.
Alice, holding William's arm, asked softly, "William, are we going home now?"
William saw Samuel's car leave through the window and said in a hoarse voice, "I'll take you home first. I have something to do."
Alice's heart sank, and she quickly asked, "What is it?"
"Just some work matters to handle. Don't worry, it's nothing major," William said perfunctorily.
Although Alice was unwilling, she agreed, "Alright then."
On the way home, Samuel noticed Victoria's low spirits and asked, "Victoria, what's wrong? Are you feeling unwell?"
Victoria tightly held the expensive box in her hand and sighed, "Samuel, I can't accept this necklace."
"Don't you like it?" Samuel was a bit surprised.
Victoria shook her head and said bitterly, "Actually, I shouldn't have come to dinner with your parents today."
Samuel's grip on the steering wheel tightened, and he forced a smile, "Why do you say that?"
